Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Dispute of Unauthorized Inquiries on My Credit Report Dear Sir/Madam : I am writing to dispute certain inquiries on my credit report that I believe to be unauthorized and therefore incorrect. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am entitled to have only accurate, verified, and authorized information on my credit report. I am requesting the removal of these inquiries from my report as I did not explicitly authorize any of them. Details of the Disputed Inquiries : Requesting Entities : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Dates : XXXX XXXX Legal Basis under the FCRA for XXXX of Unauthorized Inquiries : 1. Right to Accuracy and Verification of Information ( FCRA 611 ) : Under section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) of the FCRA, I have the right to dispute any information that is inaccurate or unverified. I am requesting that you review and verify the legitimacy of these inquiries, and if you can not do so, immediately remove these entries from my credit report. 2. Obligation to Provide Proof of Authorization ( FCRA 609 ) : According to section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) of the FCRA, I have the right to obtain all information in my file that is relevant to the inquiries conducted, including any evidence that I explicitly consented. I request that you provide this proof of authorization ; in the absence of it, these inquiries should be removed accordingly. 3. Protection Against Identity Theft and Fraud ( FCRA 605B ) : In the event that any of these inquiries are related to identity theft, section 605B of the FCRA requires you to block all information derived from such fraud upon notification. This letter serves as formal notice that none of these inquiries were authorized by me and could potentially be the result of fraud. Furthermore, I want to emphasize that, in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I do not authorize this dispute to be processed using the XXXX XXXX XXXX. Since this dispute concerns unauthorized information, it requires a complete manual review to ensure compliance with my rights to verification and accuracy of information. Thank you for your attention to this request. I look forward to receiving a written response within 15 days, as stipulated by the FCRA. Please keep me informed of any progress in the investigation process. Sincerely,

Consumer complaint narrative: I am so displeased with the way my information was used. I was trying to buy a home for my family, and I got denied due to damages on my consumer credit report. This is defamation of my character, and it's hindering my success. I take my livelihood very seriously, and I expected you all to as well. According to 15 U.S.C & 1681, you are supposed to promote fairness and accuracy on my credit report. But all I see are fraudulent and unauthorized accounts. I have been a part of several breaches, so at this point, you all should be protecting my privacy. This is detrimental to my emotional and psychological health to the point I had to have my pastor pray for me several times. I don't have access to buy a house now. I am enforcing my rights, and I expect you to be more ethical with my information. According to 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2, not one credit reporting agency shouldn't be reporting any inaccurate information anyways due to neglect use considering that I was in breach. I need help now so I can proceed to buy my family a house.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
Account number XXXX Subject : Formal Dispute Regarding Negative Item and Violation of Federal Laws To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute an inaccurate and unlawful negative item listed on my credit report. I believe this entry is not only incorrect but also reflects a violation of several federal consumer protection laws. Below, I outline the violations and request immediate action to investigate and rectify this matter. 

XXXX. Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1635 ( Right of Rescission ) : Under the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), I am entitled to specific disclosures and protections regarding financial obligations. This law provides a right to rescind certain transactions within a specific timeframe. The negative item on my report does not reflect that this right was properly honored or communicated. 


XXXX. Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( Validation of Debts ) : As per the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I have the right to request validation of any alleged debt. Despite my requests for verification, I have not received adequate proof that the negative item on my report is valid or accurate. This failure constitutes a violation of federal law. 


XXXX. Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( Communication Practices ) : The FDCPA also regulates the manner and timing of communications regarding debt. Any communication about the disputed item must comply with the prescribed standards, including restrictions on contacting me without consent or at inappropriate times. I believe these standards have not been adhered to. 


XXXX. Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( Compliance with Accurate Reporting ) : The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) mandates that credit bureaus maintain strict procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of information reported. The presence of this negative item, which I have reason to believe is inaccurate or unverifiable, indicates a failure on your part to comply with these obligations. 



Requested Resolution : XXXX. I demand an immediate investigation into this matter and the removal of the disputed negative item from my credit report. 


XXXX. Please provide me with purchase agreement verifying the accuracy and legality of the information in question, as required by federal law. 


XXXX. Confirm in writing that the disputed item has been removed or corrected within 30 days of receiving this letter. 



Failure to address this matter adequately and in compliance with federal laws may result in further action, including filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and pursuing legal remedies.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this serious matter. Please acknowledge receipt of this letter and keep me informed of your actions regarding this dispute. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

I am submitting this complaint regarding an issue I encountered with Bank of America branches in XXXX, MA, which caused significant inconvenience and financial loss. 

On XX/XX/year>, I visited the Bank of America XXXX XXXX branch to request a certified check for {$17000.00} ( plus a {$15.00} fee ) to finalize a vehicle purchase ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX MA ). As per the agreement with my dealer, this transaction had to be completed on the last working day of XXXX. Unfortunately, due to technical issues at the branch, I could not obtain the check. The staff directed me to the XXXX branch, assuring me this would not impact the transaction. 

At the XXXX branch, the staff attempted to confirm the transfer with XXXX XXXX. Still, despite their professional demeanor and efforts, they faced prolonged delays in communication with the XXXX XXXX team. Ultimately, I was informed that the funds had been frozen and that I would need to wait until the next business day to obtain the check. 

This delay caused : ( 1 ) Damage to my business relationship, as I had to reschedule the transaction with my dealer.

( 2 ) Additional expenses for transportation to revisit my dealer.

( 3 ) The loss of credibility due to an inability to meet the agreed deadline.

Consumer complaint narrative: As I remember the date of XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX I had reached out to the bank for funds in my account going missing. The bank PenFed Credit Union issued me a new card that I never received and took care of the account issue. I was told to give a few days so they can look into what happened on the account. Several days later I was issued the funds that had been asked about that came to around {$900.00}. I then transferred XXXX out of the account just to have some cash since I still had yet to receive a card in the mail. This was done on XXXX XXXX. I was issued a direct deposit from my job that I receive bi-weekly on this account for the amount of {$1800.00} on XXXX XXXX that I had no access to because my online banking was saying I have to contact the bank. I then called to see what the issue was and I was told that my account has been closed and I had no idea why. I was also told that the remainder of my funds has been sent out through check and takes anywhere from 5-7 days to get. I was then in XXXX  because I had about {$1500.00} in bills I had set to come out on this day. I had late charges now put on all of my bills since I had no-one to ask for the money without being able to give an exact date when I will pay them back. I was not able to speak with anyone higher because this bank only allows you to speak with associates and they put you on hold to speak in private with the finance and security teams. The XXXX was a XXXX  so XXXX  I called and could not get any answers. I called back XXXX  and was told that I have to wait until the closing process was done until the check can be sent. I still have no access to my account so I have to wait until the associates give me answers. The calls are documented so there is proof of me calling each day. I called XXXX  and on XXXX  I was told that I issued the account closure which I never did but out of frustration I am borrowing money to take care of some things like food for my family and travel back and forth to work. I decided to drive from XXXX XXXX to XXXX XXXX  where the nearest PenFed Credit union is which took 2 hours just to get answers. I get there on Thursday XXXX XXXX to see what is going on and the associate XXXX kindly helped me as much as possible but when told I can get the check amount from the teller, we walked out of the office space and all of the registers had been closed 15 minutes early of the bank closing. He was even frustrated to what is taking so long with them not allowing me to receive anything out of my account. I then had to leave and go home with no money so I received his card to call tomorrow so I can go and get the funds in the morning. The bank tells me then that it is nothing can be done because my account was restricted and has been closed with a {$0.00} balance. I wait until Monday XX/XX/XXXX to see has the check been sent and someone tells me that it has finally been closed and I will receive it in the mail in 5-10 business days. I have been very stressed and behind that I just received another check from my job but I'm behind to where this is not enough to cover what I have and the debt from borrowing to get things done. It is now XXXX XXXX and I am all out of money and just balancing the best way possible. This has been the absolute worse form of professionalism and customer service faced in my life.

Request for 1099-C for Account Number : XXXX Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau , I am writing to formally dispute an account with GS Bank USA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ). To date, I have not received the IRS Form XXXX for this account, which is a critical document for my financial records and tax obligations. 

Under IRS regulations, creditors are required to issue a 1099-C when they cancel a debt of {$600.00} or more. Please let me know the next steps in ensuring compliance with federal regulations and my consumer rights. I appreciate your time and assistance in this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Unauthorized Charge and Poor Customer Support Dear American Express Customer Service Team, I am writing to express my deep disappointment and frustration regarding an unresolved issue with a charge on my account and the poor customer service I have encountered in addressing it. 
Details of the Issue : On XX/XX/2024, I noticed a charge of {$590.00} from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  on my American Express account. This charge was completely unauthorized and unexpected. I did use this service once last year, which was a one-time purchase, but I was dissatisfied with it. I was under the impression that this was not part of a membership or subscription, especially given the absence of any contract or agreement I signed for recurring charges. 
Additional Concerns with the Merchant : This merchant has repeatedly reached out to me through banners, direct emails, and social media messages. However, when it comes to customer support, it is impossible to speak with an actual person. Despite contacting them several times through their chat feature, I made it clear that I was no longer interested in their product or service.

When I purchased their service last year, I explicitly mentioned that I did not wish to extend my use beyond one year. At that time, they even offered me a 25 % discount to accept their one-year service, which I agreed to and have documented proof of. Furthermore, I reiterated multiple times this year that I was not interested in continuing with their service, nor did I use their service even once in the past year.

This is clearly a scheme designed to trap customers into paying for a service they no longer use or want, and it is alarming that American Express is aiding this merchant in collecting unauthorized payments from its customers.

Steps Taken to Resolve the Issue : XXXX. Dispute Initiation : On XX/XX/2024, I contacted American Express to dispute this charge. Unfortunately, the representative I spoke to was unhelpful and argumentative, despite my clear explanation that this charge was unauthorized. I emphasized that I did not consent to any membership, subscription, or automatic renewal. 
XXXX. Merchant Contact Attempt : The representative insisted that I contact the merchant directly. However, the contact information provided led me to a website ( www.ssprg.com ) that is entirely unhelpful and appears to be part of a fraudulent scheme. The phone number provided also leads nowhere, making it impossible to reach the merchant. 
XXXX. Follow-Up Call : When I followed up on XX/XX/2024, another representative informed me that the charge was deemed valid, and I was expected to accept this renewal for another year. They offered to block the merchant from charging me next year but refused to reverse the current charge of {$590.00}. 
Key Concerns : This charge was unauthorized, and no valid subscription agreement exists. 
The merchant appears to be running a fraudulent scheme, making it impossible for customers to reach them for cancellations or support. 
I have made it explicitly clear to the merchant several times that I am not interested in their product or service and have not used their service this year. 
American Express is failing to protect its customers by siding with such merchants, effectively enabling these schemes. 
Broader Implications : Rejecting legitimate disputes against such predatory merchants not only erodes customer trust but also contributes to the rise of fraudulent schemes. American Express has always positioned itself as a company that prioritizes customer protection and satisfaction. Unfortunately, my recent experience does not reflect these values. 
My Expectations : XXXX. I request an immediate reversal of the {$590.00} charge on my account. 
XXXX. I ask American Express to thoroughly investigate this merchant for fraudulent practices. 
XXXX. I urge American Express to improve training for its representatives to ensure they understand the importance of protecting customers from unauthorized charges and scams. 
American Express has a long-standing reputation for excellence, which is why this experience has been particularly shocking and disappointing. I hope that you will take my complaint seriously and act promptly to resolve this matter. 
Sincerely, SincerelyXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX American Express Account Number XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
MIDLAND CREDIT XXXX XXXX, MI XXXX XXXX Subject : Request for Verification of Debt Dear MIDLAND CREDIT XXXX I am writing to formally dispute the validity of the debt referenced in your collection notice reported on XXXX XXXX which states that I owe {$5200.00} for Account number XXXX account number or creditor. In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request that you provide me with verification of this debt. 

To assist in the verification process, please provide the following information : XXXX. The amount of the debt : A detailed breakdown of the total amount owed, including any fees or interest. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX : The name of the original creditor and any account numbers associated with the debt. 
XXXX. Proof of Ownership : Documentation that shows you have the right to collect this debt on behalf of the original creditor. 
XXXX. Payment History : Any records that indicate payments made toward this debt, if applicable. 

Please send this information to me at the address which you should have. Until I receive the requested verification, I ask that you cease all collection activities related to this account, as required by law. 

If you are unable to provide the requested verification within 30 days, I expect that you will remove this collection from my credit report and cease all further attempts to collect the alleged debt. 

I request that you provide me with validation of this debt, including proof of ownership and the original agreement. Until this is provided, I ask that you cease all collection activities related to this account. '' Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX to 18 USC 8, I do not owe this debt. Additionally, this company is violating my consumer rights to privacy under 15 USC 1681b ( 2 ) and does not have permission to report any information using my personal data in accordance with 15 USC 1681a.

The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) took action against Portfolio Recovery Associates, one of the largest debt collectors in the nation, for violating a XXXX CFPB order and engaging in other violations of law. The CFPB filed a proposed order today that, if entered by the court, would require Portfolio Recovery Associates to pay more than {$12.00} XXXX to consumers harmed by its illegal debt collection practices, in addition to a {$12.00} XXXX penalty that would be deposited into the CFPBs victims relief fund. Portfolio Recovery Associates violated the XXXX order by collecting on unsubstantiated debt, collecting on debt without providing required documentation and disclosures to consumers, suing or threatening legal action against consumers without offering or possessing required documentation, and suing to collect on debt outside the statute of limitations. Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding a personal loan I received from NetCredit, serviced by XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. The loan terms violate Arizona 's Consumer Lender Law, specifically the interest rate caps outlined in the Arizona Revised Statutes. 

Loan Details Loan Amount : {$4500.00} APR Disclosed : 97.48 % Total Payment Scheduled : {$13000.00} over 30 months Legal Discrepancy Under Arizona law, interest rates for loans of this size must adhere to a tiered cap : 36 % on the first {$3000.00} of the principal 24 % on the remaining {$1500.00} By these standards, the total legal payment should not exceed {$8200.00}, including interest of {$3600.00}. The loan terms provided by NetCredit far exceed these limits, resulting in excessive and likely usurious charges. 

Action Requested I request your office to : Investigate NetCredit 's compliance with Arizona lending laws. 
Assist in adjusting the loan to meet legal interest rate caps. 
Impose penalties for any violations, including forfeiture of excess interest. 
Attached are copies of my loan agreement, payment schedule, and a detailed calculation of the legal interest rates under Arizona law. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. Please feel free to contact me if additional information or documentation is required. 

Sincerely, XXXX

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have had numerous problems accessing my online credit card account with Comenity Bank. They may be part of Bread Financial now. They issued my AAA Travel Advantage VISA Signature credit card. 

The first problem started a year ago, when my cashback rewards balance started always showing {$0.00} when I logged in. I had to call customer service to have them manually redeem the rewards for me because the website would not let me. It always showed I had {$0.00} rewards when in fact I had hundreds of dollars in rewards. 

At the same time, I had problems logging into the website. The website would show a spinning circle, and eventually time out when I tried to log in after I entered my login and password. On average, it would only work once out of 20 attempts. 

It would always show my phone number as unverified, and when I tried to verify it, it would seem to work but on the next login, it would still ask me to verify it. I was never able to use my phone number in two-factor authentication because it still thought it was unverified. 

The problems got much worse this summer. I called customer service on XX/XX/year> to have them manually redeem my rewards. I also asked them about my unverified phone issue. They said it was a " known issue '', but they would try to fix it. Apparently they added my phone number in, but they said since my profile " changed '', I was locked out of logging into my account for 10 days!!!! Logging into my account has not worked since then, and it is now XX/XX/year>. I have been calling them almost every week. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, a " supervisor '' said maybe deleting my online account and re-registering will fix it. She deleted my online account, and then told me I would have to wait another 10 days before re-registering. I waited, and them upon entering all the registration information, I got the error message, " Due to a technical issue, we were unable to save your response and complete your registration. Please try again. '' I tried several times with no luck. 

Supposedly Comenity is now charging me for paper statements, which is ridiculous because I can not access the online statements. 

I tried using their Bread app, with similar poor results. I have never been able to log in to my account using the Bread app. 

I have never had a worse experience with a credit card company. They do not seem to have any Tier 2 technical or IT support. The customer service reps are friendly but are not able to fix any problems and say there is not a Tier 2 to forward my issues to. They all have strong accents and are not based in the U.S. They will not give me a trouble ticket number. Their standard answer is to try again later, or that I have to wait 10 days. They acknowledge that other customers have the same issues. Comenity needs to hire experts to fix their website. This is unacceptable and I'm not sure why I haven't gotten rid of this credit card yet, but I plan to switch to a different company as soon as possible.

Consumer complaint narrative: In XXXX this year after waiting 2 years to get our solar fixed and turned on. It was to be turned on XX/XX/year>. It was installed without a permit on site. So around XX/XX/XXXX of this year, it was turned on! We were told that we would never have an electric bill! Wrong information! We never got our 18 months at {$180.00}. But got a call in XXXX that if we paid {$190.00} the next month it would be XXXX for the next 17 months! That was a lie! We are not only paying XXXX a month we are also paying over XXXX plus in an electric bill. This is something we were told we would never have to pay again! Its all a lie! XXXX is a scam! So on our roof is a {$68000.00} system and a light I bill on top of it! No one comes and checks it or services it! This is part of the contract! We have no idea if any of these panels are working, we were to be given an app to download to tell us this! Never got! Something is wrong with this system for us to be paying for electric! We have no idea who to call to come out and check this is in our contract!! If any panels are damaged the company replaces them for as long as life of loan is for and thats 25 years! Goodleap was told all this and she acted like she it was our responsibility! So we are paying and doing our part of contract but they have violated their end! During hurricane XXXX, the panels in front were bouncing up and down! Never installed correctly so we have them strapped down! If not they would wear a hole in our roof. We probably have roof damage! We dont know if any more are not installed correctly! Please let me nIf we dont pay this bill they can take our home! I want to have this taken off our roof. Its all a scam! We were told that we would get a check back from the government for over {$17000.00} to do what we want with. Thats a lie, you get a tax credit each year until the {$17000.00} plus is paid in full! No on should do solar! We did it in NY and we did good its just a big scam right now! Please help us get out of this loan we cant afford this! My husband is retiring in year and half and Im in disability. We are struggling as it is! Please help us!! Contract has been defaulted by now bank. Thats fraud!

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute the debt reported by your agency. This debt is inaccurate and should be removed from my credit report immediately. 

I vacated the property at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in XX/XX/year>, and I do not owe the amount being claimed. Therefore, I request that you provide full validation of this debt, including : 1. Proof of the original debt, including an itemized breakdown of charges.

2. Documentation showing my agreement to the alleged debt.

3. Evidence that your agency has the legal right to collect this debt.

Additionally, I demand that you investigate this matter and correct any inaccuracies on my credit report. If you are unable to validate the debt, I request that you : 1. Remove the debt from my credit report with all credit bureaus.

2. Cease any further collection activity regarding this account.

Please be advised that reporting inaccurate information or failing to validate a disputed debt violates the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). I reserve the right to pursue legal action if these laws are not followed.

I expect a written response within 30 days, confirming either the validation of this debt or its removal. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX -- - Tips : 1. Send via Certified Mail : This ensures you have proof of delivery.

2. Attach Evidence : Include any documents ( e.g., lease termination, move-out letter, or proof you left the property in XX/XX/year> ). 


XXXX. Monitor Your Credit Report : Use services like XXXX to confirm changes.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 USC 1681 section 602 a states " There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. '' Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX are consumer reporting agencies and I am the Consumer. I have the right to make sure my private information isn't shared which is backed by 15 USC 6801 which states '' It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. '' XXXX XXXX is a financial institution by definition under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 a section 2 states that " In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' XXXX XXXX the financial institution and the Consumer reporting agencies Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX do not have my consent to furnish this information and they surely do not have my written consent. Any and all consent to Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX, XXXX XXXX whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked. 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that " A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. '' XXXX XXXX Never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. Not only that 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states '' Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. '' This account is an adverse item they are reporting again without my permission which is against the law. 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A states " A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. 15 U.S. Code 1681e states '' Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX are not maintaining reasonable procedures. Also 12 CFR 1016.7 states that " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. '' I am opting out of your reporting services.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy of an account reported by XXXX XXXX on my credit report. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am entitled to accurate, complete, and verifiable credit reporting. Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I have the right to be free from misleading or unauthorized debt collection practices. Below are the issues I have identified : XXXX. Inconsistent Reporting Across Bureaus : The Account Type - Detail is listed differently across bureaus, with XXXX stating Unknown - credit extension, review, or collection, and Equifax reporting Collection. This inconsistency violates 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ). 
XXXX. Improper Dispute Status : The comments from XXXX and Equifax state that the account is disputed. If this dispute has been resolved or if the reporting is incorrect, this information must be updated or removed. 
XXXX. Potential Obsolete Reporting : The Date Last Active is listed as XX/XX/year>. If no activity has occurred since then, the account XXXX exceed the seven-year reporting limit, per 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 4 ).

4. Lack of Verification and Payment History : The report does not provide any detailed payment history or verification of how the account reached Collection/Chargeoff status. 
XXXX. Unauthorized Transfer of XXXX : I did not authorize payments to XXXX XXXX or agree to the transfer of this debt. Reporting this without my consent XXXX violate the FDCPA ( 15 U.S.C. 1692e ).

Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and FDCPA : 1. 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Failure to Ensure Maximum Possible Accuracy : Credit reporting agencies must ensure that the information they report is accurate and consistent. The discrepancies in account descriptions and comments violate this standard. 
2. 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 4 ) : Reporting of Obsolete Information : Negative information, such as collections, must not be reported more than seven years from the date of first delinquency.

3. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) : Failure to Investigate Disputed Information : If you disputed the account and it remains unresolved or improperly updated, the credit bureaus may have failed to investigate properly.

4. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) : Furnishing Inaccurate Information : The creditor or collection agency may have provided inaccurate or unverifiable information.

5. FDCPA ( 15 U.S.C. 1692e ) : False or Misleading Representations : Reporting this debt without proper verification or authorization from you to collect or transfer the debt XXXX violate the FDCPA.

In XXXX of XXXX I applied for mortgage assistance due to being laid off from my employer, Fairway in XX/XX/XXXX and again XX/XX/XXXX. I was granted a forbearance, XX/XX/XXXX suspending my mortgage payments. In XX/XX/XXXX I secured employment and contacted my mortgage company immediately to discuss my options going forward, which a loan modification appeared to be the best solution. After numerous conversations with Fairway Loss Mitigation department, begging to stop the forbearance as I was now employed, I continually have gotten the runaround. 

Finally in XXXX XXXX, I was notified ( XXXX months later ) that I was approved for a modification and would begin my trial period XX/XX/XXXX for 3 months which I have completed. I continually ask what the next steps are and can never get a straight answer. I have been harassed throughout this process with numerous phone calls and emails for months with no resolution, no update just comments they are required to contact me. 

I feel that I am being discriminated against for being a single, white, older female and harassed for being a former Fairway employee. I have requested a complete breakdown for my current unpaid mortgage balance and current monthly mortgage payment and to date have received nothing At this point I am looking for a resolution and what to know where I stand to stop the harassment.

I have additional details, phone logs, emails to support the above should they be required.

I do not normally check messages/notifications on a credit card 's website because they are usually trying to get me to increase my limit or purchase some other product, so I did not see their pdf dated XX/XX/year> " confirming my request to cancel autopay on my Visa account '', until my card was declined, I went to their messages and saw it XXXX. By then they'd charged XXXX late fees and XXXX interest charges totaling {$110.00}. I was told I was emailed the original cancellation confirm XX/XX/year> but I never received it. 

I'm attaching the website messages between us which also show my phone call attempts to clear this up. I opened a dispute with them, repeatedly requested proof of my alleged autopay cancellation, and when I learned that I needed to allow them 90 days to investigate this I paid my balance in full, including the disputed charges, and re-set-up autopay.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Debt Collector : Security Credit Services XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX Account Number XXXX {$1000.00} I received numerous letters from them about this debt. I was not provided with the original signed contract with my signature nor was I provided with apayment history associated with the account or proof of ownership of this account or verification of the original creditor. 

According to law 15 USC 1692 CC, " If a consumer notifies a debt collector that the consumer refuses to pay a debt, the debt collector must cease all communication. Therefore, reporting to my consumer report is a form of communication. 
I have made attempts to dispute on my credit reports but it hasn't been removed from either of them.

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Didn't receive terms that were advertised
Consumer complaint narrative: I heard about Wells Fargo offering a sign on bonus of XXXXXXXX XXXX for new accounts from a friend. I recent moved and XXXX of their branches was near me so I decided to change banks and take advantage of the incentive. I had a check come in from my truck warranty company for {$460.00} that I used to open the account. I went online on XX/XX/XXXX and followed the procedure using all the prompts and did successfully open a new checking account with them, however I was directed to the local branch to make my opening deposit. When I went in to make that deposit on XX/XX/XXXX I made the deposit into the account number that I received online. My bank reflects that. I receive social security checks monthly for {$940.00} via direct deposit. I moved my monthly payments over to my new Wells Fargo checking account. The first direct deposit hit my Wells Fargo every day checking account on XX/XX/XXXX for {$940.00} and has been on going to this day. Totaling XXXX months straight. I am very happy overall with Wells Fargo, however when I contacted them in regards to the XXXXXXXX XXXX incentive bonus, I was told that I needed a code in order to receive it. I was never given a code, or if I was given a code I didn't receive it. I explained how I opened the account online, but had to make my initial deposit in person. I explained that I didn't receive a code online or an email, and they didn't give me one at the branch. If an email was sent with one it is possible that it went into spam or got auto deleted, but the fact remains that I opened the account and met all the requirements. The requirements being, being a new customer opening a Wells Fargo everyday checking account, having at least {$1000.00} in direct deposit into the account within 90 days, and the account remaining open for 90 days. My account is still open to this day. I would like the XXXX XXXX that I was guaranteed for choosing them as my new bank. My first contact with them on this matter was in XXXX. It went on for months, and even went to the escalation department, or so I was told. In the end I was told without having whatever code or number I was supposed to be given, that I didn't have, I was out of luck and closed my request. I like this bank, but should close my account just out of principle. All I want is the XXXX XXXX sign on bonus that I was promised. I held up my end of the deal.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX individual {$350.00} withdrawals made from checking account to a fraudulent XXXX accounts during the period of XX/XX/year> and XX/XX/year>. 

Wells Fargo was notified of this action and referred all their investigations to a " Claims Assistance Center '' which made an unsupported determination that the transactions were authorized by a party to the account.

We, as the account holders, made multiple attempts to demonstrate that these withdrawals were fraudulent ; including numerous phone calls to the bank, written correspondence on several occasions and filing police and FBI reports. The bank disregarded this information and made the decision to deny our claim for compensation. After repeated attempts to obtain the internal documents that XXXX XXXX used to make the incorrect determination ; we finally received ( later than originally promised ) XXXX pages of gibberish that only demonstrated that the XXXX of the joint account holders had logged onto the mobile app for this account 3 times during this period for legitimate banking reasons ( XXXX separate dates vs. XXXX dates when the funds were fraudulently distributed by the bank ). The Well Fargo information also notes that " Card Authorization was not performed, or some other problem prevented verification ''. We called the bank Claims Assistance Center on XX/XX/year> for an explanation of the information that they sent us on XX/XX/year> ( received on/about XX/XX/year> ). They assured us that a representative would call on XX/XX/year> ; as was the case on multiple other attempts to obtain information and feedback directly- this return call is yet to occur as of XX/XX/year>.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Conserve I recently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you have contacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming this. Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor. 
In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor.

2. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed.

3. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor.

4. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt.

5. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor.

Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt.

Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt.

Permissible Purpose Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so.

Notification to Other Collectors I dispute that I owe this debt to you. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.
Company: Continental Services Group, Inc. d/b/a ConServe

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have a few things on my credit report that are hurting my credit profile. These two accounts are both reporting on my credit profile that were bought out by third party collection agencies, who I did not authorize or consent my personal information to. Because of this error, it is lowering my credit score, and increase derogatory marks on my credit report. I am unable to get any loans at this time and my interest rates are through the roof. Harvard Collection Service XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) XX/XX/XXXX. 


XX/XX/XXXX Harvard Collection Service XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Illinois XXXX Subject : Notice of Dispute for Improper Communication in Debt Collection Violation of 15 U.S. Code 1692c Dear Harvard Collection Service, I am writing to formally dispute your recent communications regarding an alleged debt that I am purported to owe. This dispute is in accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically 15 U.S. Code 1692c. 

In your communications dated XX/XX/XXXX of improper communication, you violated my rights as outlined in the FDCPA by : Contacting me at an inconvenient time, specifically XX/XX/XXXX. 

Contacting me at my place of employment, despite knowing or having reason to know that my employer prohibits such communications. 
Failing to communicate through my attorney, despite being informed that I am represented by legal counsel. 

These actions are clear violations of the protections provided under 15 U.S. Code 1692c. As a consumer, I am entitled to privacy and fair treatment, and your conduct has been contrary to these legal standards. 

I hereby request that you cease all further communication with me, except as legally required, and that you take immediate steps to correct your procedures in compliance with the FDCPA. Any further violations of my rights may result in legal action.

Additionally, I am requesting full validation of the debt, including : 1. Verification of the amount of the debt ; 2. The name of the original creditor ; 3. Any supporting documentation proving that I am liable for this debt. 
Please respond in writing to acknowledge receipt of this notice within 30 days. Failure to comply with this request may lead to further actions, including filing complaints with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ).

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, VA XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Federal Trade Commission XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Subject : Complaint Against Equifax for Reporting Inaccurate and Outdated Information Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against Equifax, a consumer reporting agency, for their failure to accurately report information on my credit report and for not addressing my dispute in a timely manner, as mandated by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S. Code 1681i.

For over three years, Equifax has been reporting inaccurate information on my credit report, which has not only negatively impacted my credit score but has also limited my financial opportunities. Under 1681i, I have the right to dispute any inaccurate information, and the agency is required to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation free of charge within 30 days of receiving my dispute. 

I have previously notified Equifax of this disputed information and provided supporting documentation to substantiate my claim ; however, they have failed to rectify the inaccuracies or provide a satisfactory response. Additionally, I have faxed all relevant supporting documents to the Attorney General 's office in XXXX, GA, for review. 

This ongoing issue has violated my rights to privacy and has caused significant distress. I request your assistance in investigating this matter further and holding Equifax accountable for their non-compliance with federal regulations. 

Thank you for your attention to this serious matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely,

I have the right to make sure my private information isn't shared which is backed by 15 USC 6801 which states '' It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) is a financial institution by definition under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 a section 2 states that " In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) the financial institution and the Consumer reporting agencies XXXX, XXXX and XXXX do not have my consent to furnish this information and they surely do not have my written consent. Any and all consent to XXXX, XXXX and XXXX ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked. 15 USC 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that " A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. '' ( Furnisher of information to credit agencies ) Never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. Not only that 15 USC 1681C ( a ) ( 5 ) states '' Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally raise a complaint against XXXX XXXX, XXXX for engaging in practices that violate federal consumer protection laws, including the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). This is a formal notice of my refusal to pay the alleged debt Account Number : XXXX, Amount : {$13000.00}. 
Their actions involve improper reporting of an alleged debt and persistent collection activities without adherence to legally required procedures. 
XXXX. FCRA Improper Furnishing of Information ( 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) ) XXXX XXXX, XXXX has reported information about this alleged debt to consumer reporting agencies without verifying its accuracy. As a furnisher of information, they are legally obligated to ensure the validity of any debt they report. Their failure to conduct due diligence before reporting has resulted in damage to my consumer report. 
XXXX. FCRA Lack of Permissible Purpose ( 15 USC 1681b ) My consumer report was accessed in connection with this alleged debt without a permissible purpose. I have no valid business relationship with XXXX XXXX  XXXX, nor have I consented to their accessing or reporting information about me. 
XXXX. FDCPA Failure to Validate Debt ( 15 USC 1692g ) Despite my efforts to dispute this alleged debt, XXXX XXXX, XXXX has failed to provide adequate documentation or validation to confirm its validity. Their continued attempts to collect without providing verification are unlawful. 
XXXX. FDCPA Deceptive and Unfair Practices ( 15 USC 1692e and 15 USC 1692f ) XXXX XXXX, XXXX has furnished misleading and inaccurate information about the nature and status of this alleged debt. This includes reporting an inflated or unsubstantiated balance to consumer reporting agencies. Additionally, they have engaged in unfair practices by attempting to collect on an unverified debt. 
These actions have caused undue harm by : - Negatively affecting my consumer report and financial opportunities. 
- Invading my privacy by unlawfully accessing and furnishing my personal financial information. 
- Subjecting me to emotional distress and inconvenience caused by ongoing attempts to collect without proper validation. 
I have also submitted a report to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) regarding these violations. The FTC Report Number is XXXX.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
LVNV Funding LLC and C/O Resurgent Capital Services XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, SC XXXX Re : Request for Debt Validation XXXX Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to request validation of the debt that you are attempting to collect from me. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I have the right to request that you provide me with verification of the debt and evidence that you have the legal right to collect on it. 
Please provide me with the following information : 1. The full name and address of the original creditor associated with the debt.

2. The amount of the debt, including a breakdown of any interest, fees, or other charges.

3. Documentation or a copy of the original signed agreement or contract that created this debt, including any amendments or updates.

4. Proof of your authorization to collect this debt, including any assignment or transfer of the debt to your company.

5. A detailed payment history, showing any payments or adjustments made to the debt. 
Please consider this letter as a formal request to validate the debt. As required by law, until you provide the requested validation, you must cease all collection efforts on this account, including reporting to credit bureaus. 
I would appreciate a prompt response to this request. If you fail to provide the required documentation, I will consider the debt in dispute, and I expect all collection activities to cease. 
Thank you for your cooperation.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
Account number XXXX Subject : Formal Dispute Regarding Negative Item and Violation of Federal Laws To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute an inaccurate and unlawful negative item listed on my credit report. I believe this entry is not only incorrect but also reflects a violation of several federal consumer protection laws. Below, I outline the violations and request immediate action to investigate and rectify this matter. I would like a purchase agreement.

1. Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1635 ( Right of Rescission ) : Under the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), I am entitled to specific disclosures and protections regarding financial obligations. This law provides a right to rescind certain transactions within a specific timeframe. The negative item on my report does not reflect that this right was properly honored or communicated.

2. Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( Validation of Debts ) : As per the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I have the right to request validation of any alleged debt. Despite my requests for verification, I have not received adequate proof that the negative item on my report is valid or accurate. This failure constitutes a violation of federal law. 


XXXX. Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( Communication Practices ) : The FDCPA also regulates the manner and timing of communications regarding debt. Any communication about the disputed item must comply with the prescribed standards, including restrictions on contacting me without consent or at inappropriate times. I believe these standards have not been adhered to.

4. Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( Compliance with Accurate Reporting ) : The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) mandates that credit bureaus maintain strict procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of information reported. The presence of this negative item, which I have reason to believe is inaccurate or unverifiable, indicates a failure on your part to comply with these obligations.

Requested Resolution : 1. I demand an immediate investigation into this matter and the removal of the disputed negative item from my credit report.

2. Please provide me with purchase agreement verifying the accuracy and legality of the information in question, as required by federal law.

3. Confirm in writing that the disputed item has been removed or corrected within 30 days of receiving this letter.

Failure to address this matter adequately and in compliance with federal laws may result in further action, including filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and pursuing legal remedies.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this serious matter. Please acknowledge receipt of this letter and keep me informed of your actions regarding this dispute. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I was involved in a car accident in XXXX when a drunk driver rear-ended me in XXXX, Georgia. The case was handled by the XXXX XXXX XXXX under case # XXXX. As a result, my car was totaled, and the responsible party 's insurance, XXXX XXXX represented by XXXX XXXX, assured me they would pay off the loan for the car. However, later I discovered that the insurance company did not settle the entire outstanding debt, which came as a surprise to me. 

In addition, I promptly purchased a replacement car from the same dealership, with the same lender and make of car. I usually make my monthly car payments through the Kia Finance app. In XXXX, when I went to make a payment for the new car, I noticed that the old account ( ending with XXXX ) had been closed with a balance of {$0.00}. I continued making regular monthly payments for the new car. 

The lender claims they tried to contact me in XXXX to settle the remaining amount left unpaid by the insurance company. However, I never received any communication from them. I use a XXXX mailbox, which can sometimes lead to mixed-up correspondence. At this point, the amount for the old account was still showing as {$0.00} on my app, and I was still consistently paying for the new car. 

Due to the unpaid amount, the lender reported the account as a charge-off to the credit bureaus, negatively impacting my credit score. In XXXX, both the dealership and XXXX XXXX informed me about this issue. I then checked my credit score and saw that it had dropped from XXXX to XXXX. The dealership provided the necessary information to my GAP insurance, and in XXXX, the insurance sent a check to clear the remaining balance. The amount was paid off with the GAP insurance I had purchased when buying the car. 

The problem is that the charge-off is still showing on my credit report, continuing to have a negative effect on my credit score. This negative mark will stay on my report for 10 years.

My investment business heavily relies on my credit score, and this issue has impacted my ability to borrow money. If not resolved, it will continue to affect my business for the next 10 years. I am currently in the process of asking the lender, Kia Motor Finance, to remove the charge-off from my credit report. Despite my efforts, they are unwilling to do so. I have filed a dispute to address this issue and am also considering legal options to resolve the matter.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear LVNV Funding I recently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you have contacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming this. Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor.

In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor.

2. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed.

3. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor.

4. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt.

5. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor.

Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt.

Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt.

Permissible Purpose Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so.

Notification to Other Collectors I dispute that I owe this debt to you. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

YOU HAVE MY CORRECT SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER. THANKS FOR COMPLETELY NOT RESOLVING THIS SITUATION. 
I've been told that because I have a trust, a trust does not have it's own social security number. I am the trustee, and I am using my CORRECT social security number as verified about XXXX times by your employees, who then scratch their head in confusion.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year> I placed an online order with Saks Fifth Avenue for XXXX items, XXXX dresses and a jacket, order XXXX XXXXXXXX. On XX/XX/year> XXXX delivered a box to my home containing XXXX items from the above mentioned order.When I brought the box inside my home it appeared damaged and looked like it had been opened and retaped shut. It had clear shipping tape over all sides of the box. When I opened the box there were XXXX of my ordered items inside, a XXXX XXXX faux leather dress with visible stains on the front lapel and a XXXX XXXX jacket which appeared damage free. There was nothing else in the box, no packing slip. I then contacted Saks Customer Service on XX/XX/year> to report the condition of the box and the stained dress that arrived in it. I also informed her that even though I ordered XXXX items only XXXX items were in the box and there was no packing slip, so I wasn't sure they had actually shipped all XXXX together. She asked me to send her pictures of the box and the stained dress and she would open a claim. I sent the stained dress back and waited for a response.I heard nothing from Saks for an entire month, so on XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted their customer service department again. The customer service agent I spoke with this time said no claim had been filed so she would resubmit it, Saks XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX. Again I waited for a response but never got XXXX. So I contacted Saks customer service for a third time. This time I was put hold multiple times spoke with different " managers '' who told me XXXX items were shipped and they were closing the claim. They provided me no proof, just that they contacted the warehouse and the warehouse confirmed they shipped all XXXX items. I asked them if the warehouse used the clear shipping tape to seal my package when they processed it, but they just continued to say that they shipped XXXX items. I asked for pictures of the items in my box from the warehouse, why was there no packing slip. I asked if they contacted XXXX as the box appeared damaged. They told me I needed to contact the credit card company if I wished to dispute the charges, they would be responsible for issuing me a credit. After contacting and opening claims with both XXXX XXXX  who at the time managed Saks Credit Cards and then XXXXXXXX XXXX who took them over, XXXXXXXX XXXX is now saying it is up to Saks to resolve the matter, they are responsible for handling matters related to sales, merchandise processing, returns and shipping. So now I am going around in circles as Saks is just looking to pass the buck. They have offered me no proof the item was in the box delivered to me by XXXX, they have not shown me any proof they contacted XXXX to question the damage to the box they delivered. I do not even believe they opened any investigation into this matter. It took me numerous phone calls to their customer service department to even start a claim. No one from Saks ever contacted me regarding the claim, i.e.to gather more information, etc. I never received the dress and Saks did nothing to investigate claim, the shipment or provide me with the proof the item was in the box when it was delivered to my house by XXXX on XX/XX/scrub>XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this formal complaint against Chase Bank, XXXX  XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX for the following violations : Fraudulent Reporting of Charge-Offs as Debt ( IRS Classification XXXX Income ). 
Breach of Fiduciary Duty by Ignoring My Letters and Durable Power of Attorney ( DPOA ). 
Failure to Disclose Securitization of Promissory Notes.

Non-Compliance with Audit Reporting and GAAP Standards.

Fraudulent Reporting of Charge-Offs as Debt The reporting of charge-offs on my credit report is fraudulent and misleading. According to IRS regulations, charge-offs are classified as income on a 1099-C form when reported to the IRS. Per federal law, income can not be reported as debt on a consumer credit report.

Violation : Reporting charge-offs as debt breaches the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) under 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2, which prohibits the reporting of inaccurate information. 

Demand : Chase Bank and XXXX XXXX must immediately remove all charge-offs from my credit report as these entries are misleading and harmful to my financial reputation. 
2. Breach of Fiduciary Duty : Ignoring My Letters and Durable Power of Attorney ( DPOA ) I have sent multiple letters asserting my rights, including a Durable Power of Attorney ( DPOA ), which has been ignored by both Chase Bank and XXXX XXXX. By failing to respond, these entities have violated their fiduciary obligations and undermined my rights to assert my interest in the credit. 

Legal Precedent : XXXX XXXX XXXX establishes that promissory notes fully fund credit, rendering the consumer the true creditor. As the creditor, I retain rights and interests in the credit and demand acknowledgment of the same. 
Demand : Chase Bank and XXXX XXXX must immediately recognize my rights as the creditor and provide a detailed response to all letters and XXXX documents sent. 

XXXX. Failure to Disclose Securitization of Promissory Notes It has come to my attention that the promissory notes I provided to Chase Bank and XXXX XXXX were securitized and sold without my knowledge or consent. This failure to disclose constitutes fraud and unjust enrichment. 

Violation : Under 15 U.S.C. 1641 ( Truth in Lending Act - TILA ), lenders are required to disclose the sale, assignment, or transfer of debt instruments to third parties. 

Fraudulent Omission : By securitizing my promissory notes and profiting from the proceeds, without compensating me as the original creditor, Chase Bank and XXXX XXXX have committed fraud. 
Demand : Provide full disclosure of the securitization of my promissory notes, including an accounting of proceeds and confirmation that these proceeds have been applied to offset any alleged debt. 

4. Non-Compliance with Audit Reporting and GAAP Standards Under federal law and Generally Accepted Accounting Principles ( GAAP ), financial institutions are required to provide accurate audit reports and account reconciliations.

Legal Obligation : 12 U.S.C. 1831n ( a ) mandates compliance with GAAP standards for all financial institutions.

15 U.S.C. 1637 ( TILA ) requires creditors to provide clear and accurate account information. 
Violation : Chase Bank and XXXX XXXX have failed to provide audit reports and reconcile accounts as requested. Their lack of transparency further suggests that the reporting of charge-offs is fraudulent and unsupported by proper accounting practices. 


Formal Opt-Out of Authorization and Illegality of Reporting Transaction History Per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am formally opting out of any and all authorizations I may have givenwhether written, unwritten, verbal, or non-verbalunder 15 U.S.C. 6802. As a consumer, I have the unequivocal right to opt out of the sharing and use of my non-public personal information ( NPI ) at any time.

By exercising this opt-out right : Unauthorized Reporting is Illegal : Under 15 U.S.C. 6801, it is illegal for financial institutions to report or share my transaction history without my explicit consent.

The policy of Congress explicitly mandates that every financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to protect the security, confidentiality, and privacy of its customers ' NPI. 
Violation of Privacy Rights : Chase Bank and XXXX XXXX and XXXX  XXXX XXXX have reported my transaction history and personal information to credit reporting agencies without obtaining my express consent, in direct violation of these statutory obligations.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year>, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ) received a " Cashiers Check '' ( Check ) made payable to the XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account. The Check was for expenses in conjunction with a transaction that I was acting as lawyer. I deposited the check into my XXXX Account the same day. First Interstate Bank XXXX XXXX credited the account with the entire amount of money that day. On XX/XX/year> I was sent wire instructions from my " XXXX '' to wire money to certain people in conjunction with the transaction. On the same day, I went to the bank to wire the funds. Before authorizing the wire, I asked the bank employee if the Check was good and the funds available. She said the funds were good. On XX/XX/year>, I received additional instructions to wire additional funds to others in conjunction with the transaction. I did so based upon the representations of the bank employee that the funds were available. In total I authorized {$150000.00} to be sent because the First Interstate Bank represented that the funds were available. On XX/XX/year> the First Interstate Bank was notified that the Cashiers Check was altered and fictitious. I was notified on Monday XX/XX/year> of the fraudulent check and ordered to cover the loss in the account. I covered the overdrawn account. I demanded to be made whole because the bank recognized the funds before they knew that the funds were real. I was denied my request. I believe the bank has the ability and authority to determine the validity of a cashier 's check and should not have credited the funds until it knew the funds were available.

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Difficulty submitting a dispute or getting information about a dispute over the phone
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a complaint regarding an issue with a loan I co-signed for my mother. I co-signed this loan in good faith, but I was never notified by the bank about missed payments, and I encountered significant difficulty in getting assistance to resolve the issue. As a result, the late payments were reported to my credit report, despite my efforts to address the matter. 

As the co-signer, I was not alerted by the bank when payments were missed. I was unaware of the late status of the loan until it was reflected on my credit report. Given my responsibility as a co-signer, this lack of communication left me in a difficult position. 

I never had an online account set up to make payments. Despite my efforts to resolve this issue, I could not get any help from the bank in setting up an online account or finding an alternative way to make payments. On multiple occasions, I called the bank to ask for assistance, but I was often hung up on. When I visited a branch in person, I was told that I could not get help, and despite being promised call backs, I never received any follow-up communication. 

I made payments on the following dates : XX/XX/year> XX/XX/year> Despite making these payments, the late payment entries still appear on my credit report. I believe the lack of communication and the failure to provide adequate customer service contributed to the delays in payment. 

I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this issue and assist in having the late payment entries reviewed and corrected. The lack of notification, difficulty in getting information, and poor customer service resulted in unnecessary harm to my credit, and I would like this matter resolved. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your assistance in resolving this issue.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Fraudulent Reporting of Charge-Offs as Debt The reporting of charge-offs on my credit report is fraudulent and misleading. According to IRS regulations, charge-offs are classified as income on a 1099-C form when reported to the IRS. Per federal law, income can not be reported as debt on a consumer credit report.

Violation : Reporting charge-offs as debt breaches the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) under 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2, which prohibits the reporting of inaccurate information.

Breach of Fiduciary Duty : Ignoring My Letters and Durable Power of Attorney ( DPOA ) I have sent multiple letters asserting my rights, including a Durable Power of Attorney ( DPOA ), which has been ignored by upgrade and Victoria secret By failing to respond, these entities have violated their fiduciary obligations and undermined my rights to assert my interest in the credit.

Legal Precedent : Grimes v. White establishes that promissory notes fully fund credit, rendering the consumer the true creditor. As the creditor, I retain rights and interests in the credit and demand acknowledgment of the same.

3. Failure to Disclose Securitization of Promissory Notes It has come to my attention that the promissory notes I provided to Upgrade and Victoria Secret were securitized and sold without my knowledge or consent. This failure to disclose constitutes fraud and unjust enrichment.

Violation : Under 15 U.S.C. 1641 ( Truth in Lending Act - TILA ), lenders are required to disclose the sale, assignment, or transfer of debt instruments to third parties.

Fraudulent Omission : By securitizing my promissory notes and profiting from the proceeds, without compensating me as the original creditor, XXXX and Victoria Secret have committed fraud. 


4. Non-Compliance with Audit Reporting and GAAP Standards Under federal law and Generally Accepted Accounting Principles ( GAAP ), financial institutions are required to provide accurate audit reports and account reconciliations.

Legal Obligation : 12 U.S.C. 1831n ( a ) mandates compliance with GAAP standards for all financial institutions.

15 U.S.C. 1637 ( TILA ) requires creditors to provide clear and accurate account information. 
Violation : XXXX and Victoria Secret have failed to provide audit reports and reconcile accounts as requested. Their lack of transparency further suggests that the reporting of charge-offs is fraudulent and unsupported by proper accounting practices.

1681i. Procedure in case of disputed accuracy ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general If, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall- ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

( B ) Requirements relating to reinsertion of previously deleted material About e-OSCAR ACDVs initiated by a CRA on behalf of a consumer are routed to the appropriate Data Furnisher based on the CRA and subscriber code affiliations indicated by the DF. The ACDV is returned to the initiating CRA with updated information ( if any ) relating to the consumers credit history. If an account is modified or deleted, Carbon Copies are sent to each CRA with whom the DF has a reporting relationship.

Cushman vXXXX XXXX Credit Bureaus Must Delete Without Proof.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, VA XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, D.C. XXXX Federal Trade Commission XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : Complaint Against Equifax for Reporting Inaccurate and Outdated Information Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against Equifax, a consumer reporting agency, for their failure to accurately report information on my credit report and for not addressing my dispute in a timely manner, as mandated by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S. Code 1681i.

For over three years, Equifax has been reporting inaccurate information on my credit report, which has not only negatively impacted my credit score but has also limited my financial opportunities. Under 1681i, I have the right to dispute any inaccurate information, and the agency is required to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation free of charge within 30 days of receiving my dispute.

I have previously notified Equifax of this disputed information and provided supporting documentation to substantiate my claim ; however, they have failed to rectify the inaccuracies or provide a satisfactory response. Additionally, I have faxed all relevant supporting documents to the Attorney General 's office in XXXX, GA, for review. 

This ongoing issue has violated my rights to privacy and has caused significant distress. I request your assistance in investigating this matter further and holding Equifax accountable for their non-compliance with federal regulations. 

Thank you for your attention to this serious matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely,

Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX, XXXX, Equifax, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX  are all in willful violation of FCRA 1681N due to discrimination practices and failing to closely monitor identity theft. I informed all of possible identity theft and three times my wallet was stolen with all my information including bank account numbers and social security cards. I reported this information to the above stated names but nothing was done. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Equifax Information Services LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX To Whom It May Concern, Going over my credit report, I have found it has many errors. It has come to my attention that you are reporting what I believe to be inaccurate data, which I dispute, and this letter is an appeal for your assistance. As a national reporting agency, you are governed by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( " FCRA '' ), which protects consumers from inaccurate, outdated, or invalidated information reporting of their credit file. The FCRA states that it's the Credit Bureau 's responsibility to ensure that all information contained within consumer credit files is accurate and free from errors.

According to federal law, you are required to comply with the requirements imposed under the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., including but not limited to : follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information in the consumer report, as required by 15 U.S.C. $ 1681e ( b ) ; 2 ) comply with the investigation requirements ; 3 ) should not provide consumer credit file to companies without determining that these companies had a permissible purpose to obtain consumer credit file pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681b ; 4 ) provide consumer credit file pursuant to 15 U.S.C. $ 1681g ; 5 ) et seq.

Accordingly, I request your company to provide verifiable documentary proof ( e.g., original consumer contract or similar proof bearing my wet ink signature on it ) you have on file of accounts/items listed below. Under the FCRA, if you do not provide documented and verifiable proof, you must remove all unverified, invalid, derogatory information from my consumer disclosure report. For your convenience, I am sending you a list of the items you need to verify them. These listed accounts are neither my debts nor my authorized inquiries. Please correct this by the removal of these items from my credit report. See. Exhibit A. Upon completion of your investigation, please send a detailed description of the procedures used to determine the accuracy of the account ( XXXX ) I am disputing, as well as the name and contact information of the agent conducting the said investigation in case further communication is necessary. I know that your company will need some sort of verification to prove my identity. My information is clearly shown below : Accounts that need to be removed XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX
