Consumer complaint narrative:
I purchased a used vehicle that was financed through XXXX XXXX. The vehicle was charged off in XXXX of XXXX by XXXX XXXX, However, XXXX XXXX continued with threatening collection activities to include threats of repossession of the vehicle all the way through XX/XX/XXXX. 

I never received a XXXX from XXXX XXXX for the charge off that they claimed on my personal credit report which is still showing today XX/XX/XXXX as a charge off on my personal credit report which is impacting my overall FICO score as a result of the incorrect reporting. 

I made an agreement with XXXX XXXX  to pay an agreed upon balance they claimed was still owed on the vehicle although they received a tax credit from the IRS for the written off balance owed on the vehicle. The reason why I made the agreement was because XXXX XXXX continued to threaten collections and repossession of the vehicle until the balance they claim was owed was paid on the vehicle. Therefore I am requesting a 1099c from XXXX XXXX which they were supposed to have provided to me once the account was charged off. 

I paid the agreed upon amount they requested and still had to wait over 4 months from XXXX XXXX to release the title to my vehicle. XXXX XXXX has caused a great deal of stress upon me during my dealing with their customer support and other departments within this past year alone regarding the account. I no longer choose to do any type of business with XXXX XXXX ongoing in the future and at this point, I am requesting a copy of the 1099c from XXXX XXXX that they were supposed to have provided to me once the account was charged off, so that my taxes can be prepared properly. 

Based upon my personal credit report, the account was charged off in XXXX of XXXX, however, XXXX XXXX continued to go after collections on the account through XXXX which resulted in my paying an agreed upon amount to settle the debt that they stated that I still owed on the account, although they received a tax credit from the IRS for the charge off amount on the account.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I had wired money, $ XXXX to another bank account. I went to the bank to wire. It went through with no problem. About a week later, I was informed all my accounts were closed and would not have access to my money for XXXX days. I called to find out why and was told I would find out when they send me a check of my money. They sent me an email which said the following : XXXX. We periodically review customer accounts and assess account activity. Based on a recent review of your XXXX Account account, we found that you have violated the terms of your account per the client manual. 

I reviewed the client manual and couldnt find why. I requested my money be expedited as I have no money to live on or pay bills. They repeated the protocol is XXXX days. I continued to ask why and told they couldnt tell me. I have inquired XXXX separate occasions to the specialist to expedite getting my money. They told me they would send my request. They have my {$150000.00} and refuse to release it before 60 days. How can they keep my money, do ai get interest, will they let me know anything? It is so frustrating and upsetting that I can not get my money. This had been over 30 days and I get no response. The company is Citibank. I have a credit card from them which still works, but They no longer allow my password to allow me to see my purchases or monthly accounting. This is not the first time I was debanked and had my money held hostage. I appreciate any advice on how to get my money back.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Security Fraud and Non-Compliance with Federal Laws by GM Financial Regarding XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, Tender of Payment, and Power of Attorney To Whom It XXXX Concern : I hereby submit a formal complaint against GM Financial for their egregious violations of federal law concerning the mishandling of my application, tender of payment, and Power of Attorney for a XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX valued at {$130000.00}. The following outlines the violations and unlawful actions committed by GM Financial, supported by federal statutes and pertinent case law. 

Background On XX/XX/year>, I submitted a formal application to GM Financial for the purchase of a XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, which was located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX of XXXX. Along with my application, I included : XXXX. XXXX of XXXX : An endorsed payment instrument intended to satisfy the purchase amount, accompanied by explicit instructions that if GM Financial chose not to accept my application and tender, they were to return the original documents to me promptly. 


XXXX. Power of Attorney : A legally executed document authorizing my agent to act on my behalf concerning this transaction. 



A certified mail receipt confirms that GM Financial received these documents on XX/XX/year>. To date, GM Financial has neither processed nor returned my application, tender of payment, or acknowledged the XXXX of Attorney, as required under federal and commercial law. 

Violations XXXX. Failure to Comply with the Uniform Commercial Code ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX : Tender of Payment : This provision states that if a tender of payment is made to a person entitled to enforce the instrument and the tender is refused, the obligation is XXXX to the extent of the amount of the tender. GM Financial 's refusal to process or return the tendered payment violates this provision, effectively discharging my obligation. 

XXXX XXXX : Claims to an XXXX : This section indicates that a person taking an instrument is subject to claims of property or possessory rights in the instrument. By retaining my tender without acceptance, GM Financial is unlawfully holding my property, infringing upon my rights. 



XXXX. XXXX XXXX By retaining possession of my tendered payment and application without processing them, GM Financial has engaged in deceptive practices, constituting security fraud. This deliberate act of withholding my legally valid tender of payment without action is a breach of fiduciary duty and trust. 


XXXX. Violations of the Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX. XXXX et seq. : The XXXX mandates that creditors provide applicants with a timely notice of action taken on their credit applications. GM Financial 's failure to respond to my application violates this requirement. 

Regulation B ( XXXX C.F.R. XXXX ) : This regulation requires creditors to notify applicants of action taken within 30 days of receiving a completed application. GM Financial 's non-response exceeds this timeframe, constituting a direct violation. 

Case Law Support : In XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX the court held that failing to provide notice of adverse action violates the XXXX. GM Financial 's inaction mirrors the non-compliance addressed in this case. 



XXXX. Failure to Acknowledge Power of Attorney The Power of Attorney I provided grants my agent the authority to act on my behalf in this transaction. GM Financial 's failure to acknowledge this document impedes the agent 's ability to perform duties lawfully assigned, violating principles of agency law and disregarding the legal standing of the XXXX of Attorney. 



Supporting Evidence Certified Mail Receipt : Proof that GM Financial received my application, tender of payment, and Power of Attorney on XX/XX/year>. 

Endorsement Letter : Document containing explicit instructions to either process or return the application and tender. 

Power of Attorney : Legally executed document authorizing my agent to act on my behalf in this transaction. 


Conclusion GM Financial 's refusal to process or return my application and tender of payment, along with their failure to acknowledge the Power of Attorney, constitutes clear violations of the Uniform Commercial Code, the Equal Credit Opportunity Act, and established case law. Their actions amount to security fraud and a breach of fiduciary duty owed to me as the applicant. 

This complaint serves as a formal notice of their unlawful conduct. 

Respectfully submitted, XXXX XXXX XXXX for XXXX Principal

Consumer complaint narrative:
Formal Complaint Regarding Fraudulent Account, FCRA Violations, and Unauthorized Legal Actions by Discover Bank To Whom It May Concern at the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint against Discover Bank concerning a fraudulent account opened in my name, improper reporting practices, violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), and unauthorized legal actions taken against me. 

Background and Timeline of Events : 1. Initial Identity Theft Incident ( XX/XX/XXXX ) : - While attempting to purchase a vehicle, I noticed a significant drop in my credit score. 
- Upon reviewing my credit reports, I discovered several unauthorized accounts opened without my knowledge or consent. 
- I promptly filed an identity theft report with the XXXX Police Department ( Report Number : XXXX ) and submitted a detailed complaint to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ). 

2. Implementation of Fraud Alerts ( XXXX ) : - To protect my credit, I requested and successfully placed a 7-year fraud alert with all three major credit bureaus : XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. 
- These alerts were intended to prevent any new unauthorized accounts from being opened in my name without stringent verification processes. 

3. Unauthorized Discover Bank Account ( XX/XX/XXXX ) : - Despite the active fraud alerts, a fraudulent account was opened with Discover Bank under my name, accruing unauthorized charges totaling {$7400.00}. 
- Discover Banks records indicate acknowledgment of this account being fraudulent, yet no effective measures were taken to resolve the issue on their end. 

4. Improper Charge-Off Reporting : - My Experian credit report shows that Discover Bank charged off the fraudulent account. 
- According to IRS guidelines, a creditor who charges off a debt is required to issue a Form 1099-C ( Cancellation of Debt ) to the debtor. I have never received such a form from Discover Bank. 
- Furthermore, Discover Bank continues to report this charged-off account negatively on my credit reports, which is adversely affecting my credit score and financial reputation. 

5. Unauthorized Collection and Legal Actions : - Contrary to the acknowledgment of the fraudulent nature of the account, Discover Bank initiated collection efforts against me. 
- A lawsuit was filed in an attempt to collect the alleged debt, resulting in a default judgment due to my unawareness of the legal proceedings. 
- These actions have caused significant stress, financial strain, and have unjustly held me responsible for a debt I did not incur. 

Violations Noted : - Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Violations : - Failure to accurately report information and correct known errors in my credit file. 
- Continued reporting of a fraudulent account despite evidence and acknowledgment of identity theft. 
- Negligence in conducting a reasonable investigation upon notification of the dispute. 

- IRS Reporting Violations : - Failure to issue a Form 1099-C upon charging off the alleged debt, as required by IRS regulations XXXX 

Impact on Me : - Financial Hardship : - Denial of credit opportunities and higher interest rates due to damaged credit. 
- Unwarranted legal fees and costs associated with defending myself against the wrongful lawsuit. 

- Emotional Distress : - Significant stress and XXXX  resulting from continuous collection attempts and legal actions for a debt I did not incur. 

- Reputational Damage : - Harm to my credit reputation, which affects both personal and professional opportunities. 

Steps I Have Taken to Resolve the Issue : - Provided copies of the police report and FTC identity theft report to Discover Bank. 
- Notified Discover Bank of the fraud alerts placed on my credit files. 
- Disputed the fraudulent account with all three credit bureaus, attaching all supporting documentation. 
- Attempted to communicate with Discover Bank 's fraud department to resolve the issue amicably. 


Conclusion : The actions of Discover Bank have caused undue hardship and are in direct violation of federal laws designed to protect consumers. I kindly request the CFPB 's assistance in resolving this matter promptly to prevent further damage to my financial well-being. 

Attachments : - Copy of the XXXX Police Department Identity Theft Report. 
- FTC Identity Theft Affidavit. 
- Correspondence with Discover Bank acknowledging the fraudulent account. 
- Copies of credit reports showing the erroneous entries and charge-off. 

Thank you for your time and consideration. I am available to provide any additional information or documentation required to facilitate this investigation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
Company: CAPITAL ONE, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION - GREENWOOD DELAWARE BRANCH

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative: On my initial call to the mortgage company to find out how and why in the world they were trying to charge me over XXXX in preservation fees the guy I was speaking with was saying that these charges dated back to XXXX, anytime I was late on a mortgage payment a late fee is included in that then back tracked and said if I was 30 days past due. He also said that I filed a partial claim which was included. That is a completely separate loan with HUD so there should not be any costs from my mortgage. I have a payoff statement from XX/XX/XXXX with no preservation fees. But they are trying to claim from mid XXXX to beginning of XXXX of XXXX they did over XXXX in maintenance and repairs but still have not provided me with a shred of proof. They claim they have entered my house but its on a key code. Every time I ask for the work orders they tell me they will have to get with the vendor to get them. Well how can you even bill me if you have not received work orders from your vendor. Ive ask for photo proof and they say they dont have that but claim the work was done. Ive had my buyer, contractors, inspectors in the house the entire month of XXXX and no one has been there nor done any repairs. The mortgage company has also without my consent pulled another payoff after the one that was pulled and valid thru the end of XXXX for my buyer. All of this has delayed the selling of the home and paying off the loan and mortgage flat out said to me that they will not negotiate on these fees however once I payoff the loan and they determine funds should be refunded they will do that. This is NOT right and the mortgage company PennyMac needs to be held accountable for their shady actions. You would think that they would want to resolve this issue so they could get paid off but I dont feel that way. To me it seems like they want my house back.

Sub-issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> ( XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) at the Citibank XXXX on address XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, CA, XXXX XXXX XXXX Thru ATM, I requested the ATM to withdraw {$1400.00}. The ATM machine started rolling. I noticed there was some soda residue on the drawer of the ATM. As the machine was rolling it made some rolling noise in the drawer of the ATM and then the drawer opened about a quarter of inch and shut immediately without dispensing any money. The screen on the ATM machine showed an error message. My mother who was sitting in the passenger seat of car witnessed it. Immediately after the error started another transaction and requested {$100.00} withdrawal to ensure that the {$1400.00} didn't get stuck in the drawer. The {$100.00} transaction was successful and the drawer opened and dispensed only {$100.00} as requested in the second transaction. It never dispensed the {$1400.00}. So I held my car at the ATM and asked my mother to go in the branch and ask an associate to help while I waited at the ATM. My mother went in the branch but was told that the Citibank employees at the branch can not help us instead we must call customer service. So I had to move my car out of the ATM driXXXX thru as other people were waiting behind me. I went inside the Citibank brach and ask them to call the customer service for me. The customer service started a dispute. After couple months Citibank rejected my dispute- they said their system does not show any discrepancy and will not give me my {$1400.00} back. I asked them to provide me the details and camera footage but they did not provide. I have appealed twice since then but rejected again and again. It's been almost 8 months and I am asking for my hard earned money back. Please help me get my {$1400.00} back from Citibank. 

Thanks

I am writing to file a formal complaint against US Bank regarding the recent closure of my account and the ongoing investigation they have initiated, which has resulted in my funds being frozen. 

On XX/XX/year> ], I was informed by US Bank that my account was closed due to suspected fraud, and that there is an ongoing investigation. Also that they can close my account for any reason and I can't appeal it so they don't need to explain anything. 
I have been unable to access my funds, which amount to approximately {$750000.00}, all of which are derived from a trust that I inherited. I have provided documentation to US Bank to verify the legitimacy of my funds, but I have not received a satisfactory explanation regarding the closure or the nature of the fraud investigation. 

I believe that I have not engaged in any fraudulent activity, and I am concerned that this situation is unjust and has caused me significant distress, particularly as I currently lack access to essential funds for living expenses. I am in a bind because I put all my money into US Bank instead of diversifying it now that this issue has arrived I can't pay rent my birthday is coming up I can't feed my kids I don't have any other source of funds and it's causing me a lot of problems. 

I respectfully request your assistance in investigating this matter and advocating on my behalf with US Bank. I would appreciate any guidance you can provide on how to resolve this issue and regain access to my funds. 

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt response.

Consumer complaint narrative:
LVNV FUNDING LLC GREENVILLE, SC XXXX tel : XXXX Subject : Request for Verification of Debt Dear LVNV FUNDING LLC I am writing to formally dispute the validity of the debt referenced in your collection notice reported on XX/XX/year> which states that I owe {$460.00} for Account number XXXX account number or creditor. In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request that you provide me with verification of this debt. To assist in the verification process, please provide the following information : 1. The amount of the debt : A detailed breakdown of the total amount owed, including any fees or interest. 2. Creditor Information : The name of the original creditor and any account numbers associated with the debt. 3. Proof of Ownership : Documentation that shows you have the right to collect this debt on behalf of the original creditor. XXXX. Payment History : Any records that indicate payments made toward this debt, if applicable. Please send this information to me at the address which you should have. Until I receive the requested verification, I ask that you cease all collection activities related to this account, as required by law. If you are unable to provide the requested verification within 30 days, I expect that you will remove this collection from my credit report and cease all further attempts to collect the alleged debt. I request that you provide me with validation of this debt, including proof of ownership and the original agreement. Until this is provided, I ask that you cease all collection activities related to this account. '' Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX Pursuant to 18 USC 8, I do not owe this debt. Additionally, this company is violating my consumer rights to privacy under 15 USC 1681b ( 2 ) and does not have permission to report any information using my personal data in accordance with 15 USC 1681a.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Equifax has failed to fulfill its legal obligations under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). My credit report has not been updated since XX/XX/year>, despite regular updates from creditors and the other major bureaus, XXXX and XXXX. This prolonged inaction is unacceptable, especially given that I have provided all necessary documentation and have attempted to access my account multiple times to resolve these inaccuracies. 

Equifax 's failure to update my credit report has caused severe harm to my financial standing and reputation. Despite having credit scores above XXXX with XXXX and XXXX, the outdated and inaccurate report from Equifax is creating significant barriers for me. This negligence blatantly disregards the FCRAs mandate to ensure that consumer credit reports are accurate and updated in a timely manner. 

Furthermore, I have faced repeated denial of access to my Equifax account, despite correctly answering verification questions. This obstruction has prevented me from monitoring my credit report, disputing inaccuracies, or ensuring compliance with federal law. XXXX conduct represents a systematic failure to uphold its responsibilities to consumers. 

Desired Resolution : Immediate Update of My Credit Report : Reflecting all changes, including the removal of collections as previously requested by creditors. 
Restoration of Account Access : Allowing me full and unrestricted access to my Equifax account. 
Compliance Certification : A written statement confirming XXXX adherence to FCRA requirements, including timely updates to credit reports and transparency in dispute resolution. 
Legal Notice : If Equifax fails to resolve these issues within the XXXX XXXX period, I will escalate this matter by filing an Affidavit of Truth and initiating litigation for damages caused by their gross negligence. I will also seek penalties for XXXX failure to ensure timely updates and account access, which violates federal law. 

Equifax must understand that its continued disregard for consumer rights carries serious consequences. I am prepared to hold Equifax fully accountable for the harm inflicted on me, including reputational damage, financial losses, and emotional distress. Punitive damages will also be pursued to deter such conduct in the future.

Dear To whom it may concern, Re : Cease and Desist Notice Regarding my " Signature and personal information '' and Rescission of the Contract ( Rescission is a legal remedy that allows parties to a contract to undo or terminate the contract, typically due to a material mistake, fraud, misrepresentation, or other valid legal grounds ). 

I am writing to formally demand that you cease and desist from the use of my signature or initials and rescission from all documents and including the contract which was breached at day one due to unfair ( Consumer Credit Transaction ) behavior or practice in question which is in violation of my rights under South Carolina law, specifically the South Carolina Consumer Protection Code ( S.C. Code Ann. 39-5-10 et seq. ). Your actions have caused significant harm, including [ bedbug infestation in my home, financial loss, emotional distress, violation of privacy, etc. ]. It shall be an unlawful trade practice under Section 39-5-20 for any person engaged in the business of lending money to make it a condition of obtaining a loan for the purchase of an automobile that the borrower carries full coverage comprehensive or fifty dollars collision coverage. 

Specifically not informing me that I was making a Consumer Credit Transaction ( The Sum Of All Charges ) which did not include 1 ). Insurance ( full coverage ) 2 ) disclosure of all transactions 3 ) transaction was not cash in hand 4 ) Debt Validation. 5 ) knowingly selling a defective truck which cost over XXXX in repairs. This has been problematic which include unlawful deceptive advertising, harassment, unauthorized charges, or any other consumer rights violation. 
As outlined under South Carolina law, it is unlawful for any person or business to engage in unfair or deceptive trade practices that are in direct conflict with these protections.

Four months ago ( in XXXX ), I was expecting a credit refund check to be issued to me. Despite this error, I was informed that the check had been paid out, leaving me without the refund I was entitled to.

Unfortunately, despite the considerable time and effort I have invested, I have not received the funds owed to me, nor have I received any meaningful resolution or explanation for this egregious mistake. 

This situation has caused me significant stress, frustration, and wasted time. It is unacceptable that such a straightforward matter remains unresolved, and I am deeply disappointed by the lack of accountability and responsiveness demonstrated by American Express thus far.

Product: Credit card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
I ordered shoes from Nordstrom using my Nordstrom card that were fraudulently described in the online listing as leather on XX/XX/XXXX. The return was for two items. I contacted them to facilitate a return immediately. I was instructed to leave the package on my doorstep and it would be collected by XXXX  the following Friday. I called the store again when I did not see official instructions in my email and asked for clarification. I did not pay the credit card bill as I assumed this would be resolved within the payment cycle, and since I don't have a Nordstrom location local anymore I don't regularly use the card. I was told not to worry as the pickup service will provide the label. The rep actually laughed at me for being overly concerned about the process as they assured me that it was handled. The pickup did not happen as I discovered the package mixed in with other boxes in XXXX with a handwritten note on the package that stated, " Need shipping label. '' My husband had mistaken the return for a delivery and carried the package in. I immediately contacted XXXX and explained the situation. I had to tell my story multiple times before I was transferred to card services. I was instructed to leave the package again and a label would be provided. I insisted on printing the label and they agreed to send it to me. On XX/XX/XXXX, my return was processed and I was issued store credit for the purchase amount less {$20.00} for providing the label, which they did not do. I called and I spoke with XXXX and XXXX, at which time it was explained that because of their mistake in handling the return that the merchandise was technically outside of the return window, and they would manually correct it. I was told that store credit gift card would be drained and I would see the correction on my next bill. they apologized. I had another transaction for XXXX that I paid that day through my bank to bring my account to {$0.00}. I do not use online account management for this account as I don't use it often enough to set that up, but I was told not to worry about checking the status as it was already taken care of. The rep provided a phone number to follow up begrudgingly. This conversation took nearly XXXX hours. I received a phone call on XX/XX/XXXX from XXXX. I responded by email and I have records from several customer service reps confirming that the refund was being processed, asking me allow a few days. 
I received no other communication until XXXX, when I answered a call from a toll free number. I was told they were " collecting a debt. '' During this conversation, I learned that all the apologies and promises were not processed and no one followed up with me. I was transferred to another rep where the matter was to be reopened. I spent another XXXX hours on the phone after explaining to the debt collector this merchandise was sold to me under fraudulent terms, that I was incorrectly advised on how to return the merchandise, and I was assured that my account would be processed with a return. The rep promised to revisit the matter and let me know if there were any issues. She could read the account history and she verified the facts and assured me that this would be resolved. I noted that given the decision of Nordstrom not to handle the return as promised, I had also not been issued a new merchandise credit and I reminded her that I printed the label. I did not hear back. I called to follow up when I received no response and learned that matter still had not been resolved. I spoke to XXXX and she suggested filing a dispute. I have communication from XX/XX/XXXX informing that they will not issue a credit following a review of the case. I have documentation of the transactions that includes a store credit issued on XX/XX/XXXX for the amount less the cost of label printing they did not do. I do not have a record of this store credit being sent to me.

Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint regarding unauthorized charges on my debit card originating from XXXX XXXX and the inadequate resolution process by Chime Financial. The charges, totaling {$38.00}, occurred on the following dates : {$14.00} on XX/XX/XXXX {$2.00} on XX/XX/XXXX {$21.00} on XX/XX/XXXX These transactions were not authorized by me and do not appear on my XXXX XXXX  statement for XXXX. 

Upon noticing these unauthorized charges, I contacted Chime Financial and initiated a dispute on XX/XX/XXXX ( Dispute # XXXX ). Despite my timely action, I have faced significant delays and inadequate communication from Chime. Chime informed me that investigations take XXXX business days and set a resolution date as late as XX/XX/XXXX. 

XXXX. Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ) 15 U.S.C. 1693 et seq. : Unauthorized Transactions ( 1693f ) : Under EFTA, financial institutions must investigate unauthorized transactions promptly and credit disputed amounts to the consumer 's account if resolved in their favor. Chimes delay appears unreasonable and non-compliant with the 10-business-day investigation requirement under Regulation E. 

XXXX. Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) 12 U.S.C. 5531 : Chimes inadequate response and delay in crediting my account constitute unfair practices that caused substantial injury, including financial inconvenience and the need to seek external resolution. 
The repeated delays in resolving my dispute have caused significant distress and financial inconvenience. 
Chimes lack of transparency regarding the investigation process, and failure to promptly credit my account pending dispute resolution, further complicates the issue.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute an error on my TransUnion credit report regarding my XXXX XXXX  account. TransUnion is reporting late payments on this account, but my XXXX credit report accurately reflects that the account was paid on time and closed with no late payments. This discrepancy violates the principle of uniformity of credit reports as outlined in 15 U.S.C. 1681a, which mandates that consumer reporting agencies ensure accurate and consistent reporting of consumer information.

Additionally, this inaccurate reporting constitutes a violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically : 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), which requires consumer reporting agencies to maintain reasonable procedures to ensure maximum accuracy of the information in credit reports.

15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ), which outlines the duty of a consumer reporting agency to reinvestigate disputes and correct any inaccuracies promptly. 
I request that TransUnion reinvestigate this matter per 15 USC 1681i within 15 days of this dispute, and correct the reporting to reflect accurate payment history.

To assist in your investigation, I have attached screenshots of my TransUnion and XXXX reports, clearly highlighting the discrepancy. I also request that you provide a copy of your findings and the actions taken to resolve this issue within the timeframe stipulated under 16 C.F.R. 660.4 and other relevant guidelines.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your resolution and a corrected credit report.

I can not pay this ( I could not afford {$1100.00} a month for medical insurance either )!! I asked the ER room staff if I needed to pay anything when I checked in and they said " No ''. Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to express my outrage and formally challenge the blatantly misleading and defamatory response you submitted to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) regarding my complaint. Your actions not only demonstrate a complete disregard for the truth but also amount to defamation of my character by falsely accusing me of maintaining possession of a vehicle that is no longer in my control.

Your claim that multiple documents, including one bearing my wet signature, were attached to your response is patently false. Upon review, the only document attached was a statement dated XX/XX/year>, which neither contains my signature nor substantiates any of your claims. This misrepresentation to a federal agency is unacceptable, unethical, and likely illegal. 

Additionally, your assertion that I currently have possession of the vehicle is a deliberate lie. As I have already informed your company, the vehicle was inoperable and towed away by your organization. I even spoke with your representative, XXXX, to discuss the condition of the vehicle. During that conversation, I clearly explained that the car was not functional and that the dealership had sold me a defective vehiclea temporary life vehicle that broke down beyond repair. Despite this, XXXX chose only to focus on pushing a payment plan rather than addressing the issue of the vehicles condition or ownership. 

For you to continue reporting inaccurate information to the CFPB and likely to credit bureaus is not only a violation of my rights but also an intentional attempt to damage my creditworthiness and reputation. Your actions constitute defamation, as you have knowingly spread false information about my supposed possession of the vehicle. 

Your continued failure to provide required documentation and your blatant disregard for legal obligations under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) further demonstrate your companys pattern of deceptive practices.

Consumer complaint narrative:
rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, has violated my rights. 

I looked at my Equifax credit report on XX/XX/2024 and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generally, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/year> I received an alert from my credit monitoring service that a hard inquiry from XXXX XXXX XXXX  came through. I had not authorized any credit pull, nor had I applied for any credit anywhere. I immediately contacted Transunion and was advised to file a police report and contact XXXX XXXX XXXX, which I did. After confirming my identity and researching it, XXXXXXXX XXXX confirmed that someone tried to use my information to obtain credit. The application was actually still in their processing department, but they wouldn't release any other info ( like a phone number or email address used ). But they stated they would alert Transunion that the inquiry was not authorized. On follow up, XXXX confirmed the necessary info was sent to Transunion and the inquiry should be removed. 

That was almost 5 months ago and the inquiry is still there. I filed a police report and provided the report number. Transunion is claiming I need to submit additional information and that XXXX has to submit additional information. XXXX claims they have sent Transunion the proper documentation. 

This is totally unacceptable. The company has advised Transunion that the credit inquiry was not authorized, I have told Transunion the credit inquiry was not authorized, and I sent them a police report confirming once again that the credit inquiry was not authorized. If there is no authorization from me or the creditor, how can Transunion continue to report this inaccurate information that is negatively impacting MY CREDIT SCORE. 

Transunion is the only credit bureau reporting this hard pull.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative: When my husband passed away XX/XX/XXXX he owed Chase over {$5000.00}. I was worried that with the interest I would not be able to pay this amount off. I took a balance transfer from one of my credit cards at a lower interest rate to pay it off for {$5000.00} on XX/XX/XXXX. I found out the next day that I was not responsible for my husband 's debt. I called my credit card company first to stop the transaction since it had not yet posted and they said the transaction was already being processed and that I should call Chase. I called Chase and they agreed that I was not responsible for the debt and said that once the transaction was complete they would return it to my credit card company ( XXXX ). After several days passed and the money was not returned I called Chase, they asked me to submit a death certificate and a letter explaining why I wanted the money returned which I mailed to them. I called a week or so later and they confirmed they received the letter. I also called XXXX since the money was supposed to be returned to them, they opened a case and said they would follow also follow up with Chase. XXXX called back several weeks later, they asked if I had heard from Chase. They said they had not received the money and despite several attempts they had received no response from Chase but there was some sort of time limit and they still had some time. XXXX called again several more weeks later saying that they still had no response from Chase and asked if we could 3 way call them which we did. They told us that my request had been denied. We asked why and the person we talked to said we they could not tell us but I could submit another request.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Urgent Request to Resolve Account Lock Due to Identity Verification Dear Bank of America Customer Support Team, My name is XXXX XXXX and I have been a loyal customer of Bank of America for the past 6 years. 
My account number is XXXX and I am writing to express my urgent concern regarding the complete block of my account, which has left me unable to access essential funds. 

Recently, I attempted to update my phone number in the Security Center of my online banking profile to reflect my current international contact number. The update was successful. However, on [ data exata do incidente ], while in XXXX XXXX, XXXX, I attempted to use my debit card via XXXX XXXX for a transaction of approximately {$580.00}. The transaction was declined, and I received a verification prompt within the app, which I promptly confirmed To my dismay, the debit card remained blocked, and shortly after, my access to both the app and the Internet Banking platform was completely restricted. 

My Attempts to Resolve the Issue : I immediately contacted the Fraud Department and subsequently the Debit Card Department. Despite providing all the requested information and offering to submit any additional documents to verify my identity, I was informed that the only way to resolve this issue would be to appear in person at a Financial Center in the United States. 

This requirement is not feasible for the following reasons : 1.I am not in the XXXX XXXX , and my XXXX  has expired, which the renew was not have been applied yet.

2.Traveling to the United States is both logistically and financially impossible at this time. 

Impact of the Account Access Blocked : My account holds approximately {$700.00}, which I urgently need for living expenses. 
My XXXX daughters account, also with Bank of America, contains {$2000.00}, which she needs immediately for her regular expenses. 

Request for Resolution : I respectfully requested that Bank of America provide an alternative method for identity verification, given my circumstances. 
I am willing to submit any documentation necessary, including my passport, proof of residence, and any other information required to confirm my identity and resolve this issue remotely It is unreasonable and unfair to block access to essential funds without offering a viable alternative for customers residing abroad, especially when all necessary information to authenticate my identity has been provided. 

: I trust in Bank of Americas commitment to its customers and hope this matter can be resolved without further complications Please treat this as an urgent request and let me know the next steps I can take to regain access to my account. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX Account Holder : XXXX Phone : XXXX or XXXX Email : XXXX.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
First, I Do Not Consent to be Surety of any alleged debt. I Do Not Consent to be Guarantor of any alleged debt. 

Numerous times starting XX/XX/year>, I have mailed TD Bank the attached Debt Validation and Debt Verification Requests ( delivered XX/XX/year> at XXXX XXXX  ), a Notice of Fault and Opportunity to Cure along with the Billing Error Notice, and a Notice to Opt Out of all Credit Reporting or Credit Furnishing through all Major Credit Reporting Agencies ( delivered XX/XX/year> at XXXX XXXX  ), and the Notice of Default and Final Statement ( delivered XX/XX/year> at XXXX XXXX  ) however TD Banks employees never properly responded to any of my Notices. They were never answered. They never followed my orders to Cease and Desist contacting me by phone instead TD Banks employees just kept harassing me with phone calls all throughout the day and mailing letters containing only partial statements. A half of a Statement is not a bill nor a proper Statement. They never sent me both the Accounts Receivable and the Accounts Payable.

Instead, they've used non-compliant and deceptive tactics to mislead me to make a payment of which I did not owe. As a Fiduciary, they never credited my account properly - according to the law. I was never given Valuable Consideration this entire agreement and TD Bank has been in default for a long time. They continue to report false information to my credit report or consumer report against my wishes and without my written permission which can be a form of identity theft ( a crime ). They are also violating several criminal and civil laws/ statutes of the Federal Consumer Credit Protection Act ( includes the Federal Truth in Lending Act ) or Consumer Credit Protection Act ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) of the Statutes At Large. 

Upon further review, it is evident that the Issuer has committed several violations, rendering the contract or agreement unenforceable. Such as : 1. Lack of Mutual Assent and Consideration : The contract lacks mutual consent and valid or lawful consideration, violating the Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ) 3-104 and 3-303 regarding negotiable instruments and consideration. 

2. Absence of Issuers Signature : The Issuers failure to sign the agreement signifies a lack of Acceptance and agreement to the terms, thus failing to create a legally binding bilateral contract as required by UCC 3-401. 

3. Unconscionability : The terms of the agreement are unconscionable, imposing undue burdens solely upon [ Borrower 's Name ] without corresponding duties or risks assumed by the Issuer, in violation of the principles of fairness under UCC 2-302. 

4. Misrepresentation and Fraud : The Issuers representation of the instrument as a valid loan agreement, while failing to sign and thereby not committing to any obligation, constitutes a misrepresentation and potentially fraudulent inducement, violating Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) regulations under 16 CFR Part 433 and federal fraud statutes ( 18 U.S.C. 1341 and 1343 ).

5. Non-performance : The Issuer defaulted on its obligations by failing to properly respond and answer consumers questions and complaints in regard to the transaction. 

And other violations of law such as : 82 Stat. 152 CHAPTER 2 CREDIT TRANSACTIONS 121. General requirement of disclosure, 125. Right of rescission as to certain transactions, 127. Open end consumer credit plans, XXXX. Civil liability TITLE II EXTORTIONATE CREDIT TRANSACTIONS XXXX. Making extortionate extensions of credit, XXXX. Collection of extensions of credit by extortionate means, SECTION 37-5-108.Unconscionability ; inducement by unconscionable conduct. 

Part 2 - Debtors ' Remedies SECTION 37-5-202.Effect of violations on rights of parties., SECTION 37-5-203.Civil liability for violation of disclosure provisions., SECTION 37-5-205.Refunds and penalties as setoff to obligation.

Part 3 - Criminal Penalties SECTION 37-5-301.Wilfull violations., SECTION 37-5-302.Disclosure violations., SECTION 37-5-303.Fraudulent use of cards. 

Notice and Demand Considering the many violations, those listed and those unlisted, XXXX XXXX hereby demands the following remedies : 1. Return of all Payments Made : Immediate return of all payments since the inception of the purported agreement. 

2. XXXX Balance on Account : Issuance of a balance of XXXX on the account, considering that the value was created by the instrument signed by XXXX XXXX and the funds were already generated. 

3. Removal of Negative and Derogatory information from all Consumer Reports/ Credit Reports : Immediate removal of negative items and derogatory/ defamatory information from all consumer reports or credit reports. 


Caveat / Warning If XXXX XXXX is unable to get any cooperation from TD Bank and its employees in regards to these violations of law then I will be put my States Attorney General on Notice because I will be launching a formal investigation with the ( CFPB ) Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, the IRS Criminal Investigations Division, the FDIC Federal Deposit Insurance Commission, the Security and Exchange Commission and filing a Claim against TD Banks companys Bond and Insurers for the Misappropriation of Funds along with tax evasion, non-compliance and fraudulent and deceptive practices.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
CAINE & WEINER has been attempting to collect a debt that they don't have any rights to according to UCC 3-203. and has also given my information away to consumer reporting agencies infringing on The Privacy Act of 1974. 3-203. I have never done business nor has had a contract with CAINE & WEINER. Transferring a security doesn't give rights to whoever it transferred to and only the original creditor can come after me, which is who I signed with, but they lost their rights once they transferred. UCC 3-203 TRANSFER OF INSTRUMENT ; RIGHTS ACQUIRED BY TRANSFER. 
Primary tabs ( a ) An instrument is transferred when it is delivered by a person other than its issuer for the purpose of giving to the person receiving delivery the right to enforce the instrument. 

( b ) Transfer of an instrument, whether or not the transfer is a negotiation, vests in the transferee any right of the transferor to enforce the instrument, including any right as a holder in due course, but the transferee can not acquire rights of a holder in due course by a transfer, directly or indirectly, from a holder in due course if the transferee engaged in fraud or illegality affecting the instrument. 

( c ) Unless otherwise agreed, if an instrument is transferred for value and the transferee does not become a holder because of lack of indorsement by the transferor, the transferee has a specifically enforceable right to the unqualified indorsement of the transferor, but negotiation of the instrument does not occur until the indorsement is made. 

( d ) If a transferor purports to transfer less than the entire instrument, negotiation of the instrument does not occur. The transferee obtains no rights under this Article and has only the rights of a partial assignee.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I had filed a couple previous complaints and am asking if this new complaint and information can reopen the previous two cases I had to replace my battery not long ago and the receipt is attached, I also was informed that upon getting my mainfold bolts replaced on passenger side only, that my ABS Module Sensor was bad, my Heater will need to be replaced due to no heat, and that i will need to reschedule another day so that my drivers side maifold bolts can be fixed as well. 
Upon, Leaving the VA, I went to XXXX next door, I pulled out a Blower motor Relay to check if it was blown and the ABS Module relay, in which, XXXX relays had some corrision on them, I went into XXXX to see hiw much these relays would be. 
Upon leaving XXXX, I started the truck fine and let it warm up a little more, I than went to put the Truck into Reverse and found the I could not shift from park to reverse. 
Upon exiting the Truck, Observed that the headlights flashed several times, than I found that my rear light tail light was the only one working as to my drivers side headlight only worked, I reset the eletronic control module by touching the positive and negative battery cables together for 30 secs. The end result was the same. 
When calling XXXX Premium Extended Warranty for Approval, They informed me that it would cover XXXX, meaning to me that the tow was covered, I get a call from the towing company informing me of an unpaid balance of XXXX dollars which needed to be paid first? Not understanding any of this I paid it, the tow truck driver didnt understand why that was said when my warranty covered the deductable for XXXX dollars. 
I am asking if there is anything you can do or make any calls to Credit Acceptance or XXXX in order for me to get a rental car at there expense come Monday afternoon as the truck has been sitting at the Mechanic Shop since Tbursday and wont be looked and diaginosed until monday and hard telling when all other items will be fix and how long it will take. 
I feel that Credit Acceptance should be become more liable an or enforce the vechile contract onto the sellers at this point and make them liable as they would have me if i was to violate the purchase argeement that was signed by me and the seller. The seller sold me a truck and hidden details about the truck and did not disclose the vechile history or repairs thst the truck has gone through, in which i did not become aware thst they were suppose to when until i reread through the vechile contract.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/2024, I received a letter from Target Card Services notifying of an outstanding balance regarding a recent purchase in the total of {$38.00}. After verifying the debit charge not clearing on my account, I made immediate payment the same day XX/XX/2024. I then logged onto the Target Card Services transaction portal and notified them payment was made through TD Bill Pay. On XX/XX/2024, the payment of {$38.00} was processed withdrawn from the account. A final notice letter from Target Card Services dated XX/XX/2024, was recieved attempting to collect the {$38.00} which had been been paid on XXXX XXXX. After messaging Target Card Services that payment had been made, they denied payment was recieved despite providing a the bank and confirmation number to them multiple times. Target Card Services opened a dispute based on my complaints. On XX/XX/2024, I sent certified mail to Target Card Services and provided proof of payment from my banking institution. On XX/XX/2024, I received a letter from Target Card Services with a Minnesota address claiming they had not heard from me as of XX/XX/2024, depsite me having proof I sent them certifed mail and they signed and returned it to me during this time. They also never provided me with a written dispute case number leaving doubt a dispute was ever opened. In response to this, I sent certified mail again this time to the Minnesota address notifying them that it is deceptive to trick customers by changing addresses. This certifed letter also included multiple copies of proof of payment of the {$38.00} through TD bank, along with proof of contact with Target Card Services between the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX disputing their claim of not hearing from me. On XXXX XXXX XXXX I received a letter from Target Card Services claiming the {$38.00} remains unpaid and the documents I sent as proof of payment were not enough. The balance was paid on XX/XX/2024, through TD Bill Pay in full.

Product: Mortgage
Sub-product: Home equity loan or line of credit (HELOC)
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have a HEI lien on my home that I am selling., with Point Home Equity Investment XXXX 
They sent me three totally different payoff amounts, I originally took out XXXX in XXXX. 
I just signed a contract to sell my home on XX/XX/XXXX, before foreclosure. 
First, they asked for the signed contract, and sent me an amount of XXXX due. This made sense, because the house sold for only XXXX, under the appraisal amount when I took out the loan. 
An email was sent with a payoff of XXXX also, several months ago. They originally sent me this before I signed the contract to sell. 

NOW- they are claiming the payoff is over XXXX. 

They are claiming, nthe home value of XXXX is the percentage they went by, when the Notice of Default was served, in XX/XX/XXXX. 
I am ready to close with the title company, but Point is kicking me while I'm down. I'm having to sell my house to avoid foreclosure I checked the Point contract and is states " in some cases of default '', the payoff goes by what the value was at the time of the Notice of Default. 
Apparently this is " some case '' because they chose to gouge me. 
There is something not right about this. 
Point low-balled my home appraisal, using their appraiser, ( bias ), when I was getting the loan.

But now they go by market value, when it's time for them to be paid back. 
They reneged on the correct payoff, the one I sent to the buyer. 
They knew about the Default all along, they are involved in the foreclosure lawsuit. 
Why even request the signed contract to begin with? 
Very unprofessional. 
And they ripped me off. 
Sneaky, unethical and unscrupulous business practice. 
This isn't the last time you will be hearing from me.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Page 1 of 4 DEBT VALIDATION LETTER Date ___________________ ___________________ ___________________ ___________________ Dear ___________________, This letter is being sent to you in response to : Check One ( 1 ) - Notice sent to me on XXXX_______________, 20___XXXX Response to a listing on my Credit Report.Be advised this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice sent pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 USC 1692g stating your claim is disputed and validation is requested. This is NOT a request for verification or proof of my mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to the above-named Title and Section. I respectfully request your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you. At this time, I will also inform you that if your offices have reported invalidated information to any of the 3 major credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX or XXXX ) this action may constitute fraud under both Federal and State Laws. Due to this fact, if any negative mark is found on any of my credit reports by your company or the company that you represent, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against you and your client for the following : Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, and Defamation of Character. If your offices are able to provide the proper documentation as requested in the following Declaration, I will require at least 30 days to investigate this information, during which time all collection activity must cease and desist. Also, during this validation period, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of my credit reports, I will consult with my legal counsel for suit. This includes any listing of any information to a credit reporting repository that could be inaccurate or invalidated. If your office fails to respond to this validation request within 30 days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from my credit file and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to me immediately. Sincerely, ___________________ Page 2 of 4 CEASE AND DESIST I would also like to request, in writing, that no further telephone contact be made by your offices to my home or to my place of employment. If your offices continue to attempt telephone communication with me it will be considered harassment and I will have no choice but to file suit. All future communications with me MUST be done in writing and sent to the address noted in this letter. It would be advisable that you and your client assure that your records are in order before I am forced to take legal action. Sincerely, ___________________ Page 3 of 4 CREDITOR/DEBT COLLECTOR DECLARATION Please provide all of the following information and submit the appropriate forms and paperwork within 30 days from the date of your receipt of this request for validation. Name and Address of Alleged Creditor : ______________________________________________________________________ Name on File of Alleged Debtor : ______________________________________________________________________ Alleged Account # : ______________________________________________________________________ Address on File for Alleged Debtor : ______________________________________________________________________ Amount of Alleged Debt : ______________________________________________________________________ Date ( that this alleged debt became payable ) : ______________________________________________________________________ Date of Original Charge or Delinquency : ______________________________________________________________________ Was this Debt assigned to a Debt Collector or Purchased? ______________________________________________________________________ Amount Paid if Debt was Purchased : ______________________________________________________________________ Commission for debt collector if collection efforts are successful : ______________________________________________________________________ Page 4 of 4 REQUESTED INFORMATION Please attach copies of the following : Agreement with your client that grants ___________________ ( Collection Agency Name ) the authority to collect this alleged debt. Signed agreement Debtor has made with Debt Collector, or other verifiable proof Debtor has a contractual obligation to pay Debt Collector. Any agreement that bears the signature of Debtor, wherein agreed to pay Creditor. All statements while this account was open.

Have any insurance claims been made by any creditor regarding this account? YES- NO Have any judgments been obtained by any creditor regarding this account? YES - NO Please provide the name and address of the bonding agent for ___________________ ( Name of Debt Collector ), in case legal action becomes necessary : ______________________________ ______________________________ ______________________________ Authorized Signature of Creditor : ______________________________ Date : _________________________ You must return this completed form along with copies of all requested information, assignments or other transfer agreements, which would establish your right to collect this alleged debt within 30 days from the date of your receipt of this letter. Your claim can not and WILL NOT be considered if any portion of this form is not completed and returned with copies of all requested documents. This is a request for validation made pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. Please allow 30 days for processing after I receive this information.

Recently, a debt was added to my credit report. Upon noticing this, I immediately contacted Transworld Systems via phone and email to address the matter. Unfortunately, I was hung up on twice. When I was finally able to speak with someone, I was informed that they had mailed me certification of this debt and that I should already have it.

I explained that I have moved states twice in the past two years due to workonce to XXXX and later to XXXXand if the certification was sent to those addresses, I never received it. Despite this, the representative continued to harass me and used threatening language, including stating that they would sue me, in an apparent attempt to coerce me into making a payment. 

I reiterated that I require proper certification of this debt before proceeding, yet I have not been provided with the necessary documentation.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I purchased a used vehicle that was financed through Veros Credit. The vehicle was charged off in XXXX of XXXX by Veros Credit, However, Veros credit continued with threatening collection activities to include threats of repossession of the vehicle all the way through XX/XX/XXXX. 

I never received a XXXX from Veros Credit for the charge off that they claimed on my personal credit report which is still showing today XX/XX/XXXX as a charge off on my personal credit report which is impacting my overall XXXX score as a result of the incorrect reporting. 

I made an agreement with Veros credit to pay an agreed upon balance they claimed was still owed on the vehicle although they received a tax credit from the IRS for the written off balance owed on the vehicle. The reason why I made the agreement was because Veros Credit continued to threaten collections and repossession of the vehicle until the balance they claim was owed was paid on the vehicle. Therefore I am requesting a XXXX from Veros Credit which they were supposed to have provided to me once the account was charged off. 

I paid the agreed upon amount they requested and still had to wait over 4 months from Veros Credit to release the title to my vehicle. Veros Credit has caused a great deal of stress upon me during my dealing with their customer support and other departments within this past year alone regarding the account. I no longer choose to do any type of business with Veros Credit ongoing in the future and at this point, I am requesting a copy of the XXXX from Veros Credit that they were supposed to have provided to me once the account was charged off, so that my taxes can be prepared properly. 

Based upon my personal credit report, the account was charged off in XXXX of XXXX, however, Veros Credit continued to go after collections on the account through XXXX which resulted in my paying an agreed upon amount to settle the debt that they stated that I still owed on the account, although they received a tax credit from the IRS for the charge off amount on the account.

From XXXX XXXX my Chase debit card was used XXXX times as it was comprised by thieves or hackers. They used my card at XXXX local XXXX stores by making a purchase then withdrawing {$100.00} cash XXXX times. Also, they made XXXX consecutive withdrawals at a cash station totaling {$1000.00}. Altogether the thieves walked away with {$5500.00} from purchases at XXXX along with {$1000.00} using my debit card over the course of XXXX days. These transactions took place in the late evening hours towards store closing times. 

Due to my memory problems I was unable to file a claim in the correct state of mind. I let my son speak on my behalf which Chase agreed to. They were able to credit my account for the {$1000.00} cash withdrawals from a separate claim. That claim was submitted on XX/XX/XXXX and approved on XX/XX/XXXX. 

To this day there is now a matter of {$5500.00} still unresolved. I have spoken to XXXX separate escalation managers named XXXX and XXXX and no resolution has been made. I spoke to XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX and he explained a technical error occurred and the money would be refunded within XXXX days. Unfortunately all I received was a rejection letter that reads " We found that the transaction ( s ) was processed according to the information you provided or was authorized. '' On the morning of XX/XX/XXXX I spoke to another escalation specialist named XXXX and went through every single fraudulent transaction along with explaining the circumstances from XXXX XXXX. She was nice enough to conduct thorough research and explain why XXXX separate claims for {$5500.00} were rejected. After spending XXXX hour and XXXX minutes on the phone, she made an assurance that " money would be refunded within a few hours. '' It is now XXXX XXXX  on XX/XX/XXXX and still I have not been refunded. 

I am beyond frustrated and unable to retrieve this money. I have banked with JP Morgan Chase for many years and never had this problem before. The escalation managers can be reached at XXXX.

If it were myself, owing them this money, they would be upset with all the runaround and lack of information I have been given. The bottom line is, that I want the refund of the amount I paid in when it was a time I did not have to make payments ( {$390.00} ). The very last time I called I was told my loan was now with XXXX but because it was in XXXX 's hands at the time of the refund period, Mohela would issue my refund after it came from the US Treasury. I am owed XXXX payments of {$190.00} ( XXXX ) but was told I was issued a refund for {$27.00} which is an odd amount and I am not sure what that is about. At the end of my phone call, I was told to check with XXXX about the matter which I did and they said also it would be Mohela to submit the request. I have filed a complaint with the XXXX  on this matter ( # XXXX ) and now, I am submitting a request/complaint to you. I need and want my refund, please. I hope you can go back and listen to the recorded messages when I inquired about my refund and also any requests and correspondence made in their systems. I have requested it but have never received any documentation. More training needs to happen within Mohela as it stands right now. Twice I asked for supervisors and was told they were not allowed to send me to a supervisor. If you would kindly respond to my message here and take care of this matter of getting my refund submitted with a callback to me to give me a status update, I would so appreciate it. 

I look forward to your response. Thank you, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I initially began banking with the aforementioned sometime last year. I liked the ease because it's " digital '' but " digital '' does not mean Good nor Logical.

I also asked why wasn't I given the option to have it rushed or expedited, but somehow it's impossible? Also, no tracking number, so I don't know when my card will arrive, what shipper will be dropping it off and I'm sure I won't have to sign for it. A debit card at that. My hard earned money is simply slipped into a plain envelope and MAILED to me. While the business acts as if they have no RESPONSIBILITY. Also, being that SoFi is a DIGITAL bank, one would think they would have more options other than a MOBILE WALLET. Why is there no virtual or temporary card options? I'll be closing my account by the end of this month & moving my money into a XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX in my area. Sofi ... Do Better

Consumer complaint narrative: I applied for an XXXX card through Chase Bank. There was a hard inquiry placed on my credit report. Shortly after I received a letter asking me to call a number to confirm that I actually applied for the card. I called the number and confirmed that I did indeed apply for the XXXX card. In the end I never received a card or a denial letter, yet there are two hard inquiries on my credit report. This has affected my score and my ability to get a loan.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Re : Formal Complaint Regarding Violation of FCRA and Improper Reporting of Paid Collection To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to file a formal complaint under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) regarding the inaccurate and improper reporting of a paid collection on my credit report. First of all it should never have been reported as a collection, I switched service addresses with XXXX  and instead of transferring services they created a whole new account instead of doing it properly. Despite paying this account in full, the creditor and the credit reporting agencies continue to inaccurately report it as unpaid or unresolved. This failure to update and verify accurate information is a clear violation of FCRA regulations, particularly 611 ( a ) and 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). 

Under the FCRA, furnishers and credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of consumer credit reports. The continued reporting of this paid collection account demonstrates blatant noncompliance with these standards. Additionally, I suspect that the XXXX system, which automates dispute processing, has failed to adequately investigate my dispute, violating my rights as a consumer. 

Specific Issues : 1. Violation of 611 ( a ) : The credit reporting agencies failed to perform a reasonable reinvestigation of the dispute I submitted regarding this account. 
2. Violation of 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : The data furnisher failed to report accurate information after being notified of the error. 
3. Improper Use of XXXX Codes : The use of inadequate XXXX codes likely resulted in an automated and insufficient dispute resolution process, failing to address my specific concerns. 

Requested Action : I demand the immediate removal of this collection account from my credit report as it has been paid in full and should no longer be reported as derogatory. Failure to correct this matter will leave me with no choice but to escalate this issue, including filing a formal complaint with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), exploring legal action, and seeking statutory damages for willful noncompliance under 616 of the FCRA. 

Attached, please find copies of the following : 1. Proof of payment for the collection account.

2. A copy of my credit report highlighting the inaccurate entry. 

I expect your acknowledgment of this complaint and resolution of the matter within 15 days, as outlined in the FCRAs procedural timeline. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX Enclosures : Proof of Payment, Credit Report Highlights

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I submitted a XXXX  Misconduct Discharge application to Navient with supporting evidence which demonstrated XXXX XXXX misconduct and how it negatively impacted me. 

On XX/XX/year>, I received a decision from Navient denying my application for a XXXX XXXX XXXX. The included rationale for the decision stated that, A variety of factors are considered in determining whether a private loan should be XXXX based on school misconduct and you do not meet the requirements for discharge based on misconduct by your school. Subsequently, I spoke to a Navient representative via phone and asked for clarification on the factors that Navient used to make their decision, so that I could try to satisfy them further. I was told that the factors that Navient uses to decide whether to discharge private student loans related to school misconduct are proprietary and would not be divulged to me. 

On XX/XX/year>, I again spoke to a Navient representative and asked for another XXXX XXXX XXXX application, because I have new information to submit. The representative at first refused. When I pressed her for why, she than said that she could sent me another application but that it wouldnt change the results because it would just be a duplicate application. 

It has been well documented in the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  engaged in misconduct by misrepresenting its job placement rates, and exaggerating likely earnings of graduates from its programs. I have shown that I graduated from XXXX with a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  and that I am therefore included in this harm caused by XXXX. As evidenced by the fact that I have received settlements in the XXXX cases relating to school misconduct by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX University FTC XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  My original private XXXX  loan amounts totaled {$42000.00}, I have been paying on them for 15 years, and they now total XXXX a increase of 65 %. I have been unable to obtain fXXXX XXXX. I have often been unable to afford to rent an apartment, let alone to buy a house. I have slept on friends couches. During the worst of times and have had to resort to living with my XXXX  mother, as a XXXX man, this was incredibly humiliating. I am only housed now because, as a veteran, I have been able to obtain a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and live in a tiny apartment. I have been unable to save for retirement or save anything, for that matter. And as I approach my senior years, the future looks bleak. I often ponder how much better my life would have been, had I never attended XXXX, without being {$140000.00} ( XXXX and XXXX combined ) in student loan debt for an education that was worthless. 

Navient is culpable in the damages caused XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX. The FTC has stated that student loans are within the scope of the XXXX XXXX. For private loans, the borrower XXXX be able to cancel existing debt if a XXXX  fraudulently induced the XXXX XXXX XXXX  and had some relationship with the lender.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute a debt claim of {$3400.00} made by IQ Data International, a debt collection agency. I believe this debt is unjust and inaccurate, and I am seeking your assistance in resolving this matter. 
Details of the Complaint : Debt Collector Information : Debt Collector : IQ Data International Claimed Debt Amount : {$3400.00} Background and Discrepancy : The alleged debt is related to a rental property. However, I have never been late on rent nor left any damages to the property in question. 
In fact, I have documentation from the property manager, including a move-out statement, which confirms that I left the property in good condition and fulfilled all rental obligations. This statement clearly states that no damages were caused, and my account was in good standing upon my departure. 
Action Taken : Upon receiving notice from IQ Data International regarding this debt, I immediately requested validation and supporting documentation to confirm the legitimacy of the debt. Despite this request, I have not received any proof or clear explanation showing why I am being held responsible for this alleged debt. 
I have also attempted to resolve the issue directly with IQ Data International though, but have received no satisfactory response or evidence to justify their claim.

Negative Impact : As a result of this unjust debt claim, my credit may have been negatively impacted, and it is causing unnecessary stress and confusion.

This inaccurate debt claim is affecting my ability to apply for credit and make important financial decisions. 
Supporting Documentation : Move-Out Statement from the property manager, confirming that I left the property in good condition and did not cause any damages.

Video of the dwelling during move-out.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I booked a one night stay for XX/XX/XXXX at the XXXX XXXX XXXX with Chase Travel and prepaid {$120.00} on XX/XX/year>. I stayed at the hotel, was charged the {$120.00}, and received an additional charge of {$100.00} by the XXXX XXXX XXXX on my statement. When I contacted the property and asked what the fee was for, they said they did not charge me the {$100.00} and have no record of the charge. They told me there is no folio for the stay and they have no record of the charge being made. 

I did not sign, authorize, or give my credit card for the {$100.00} charge. Essentially, I am being double charged for the one night stay and Chase has not been of any help in resolving the issue even after I filed a fraud complaint.
